src/fitpack.f

00001       subroutine curv1 (n,x,y,slp1,slpn,islpsw,yp,temp,
00002      *                  sigma,ierr)
00003 c
00004       integer n,islpsw,ierr
00005       real x(n),y(n),slp1,slpn,yp(n),temp(n),sigma
00006 c
00007 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
00008 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
00009 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
00010 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
00011 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
00012 c
00013 c this subroutine determines the parameters necessary to
00014 c compute an interpolatory spline under tension through
00015 c a sequence of functional values. the slopes at the two
00016 c ends of the curve may be specified or omitted.  for actual
00017 c computation of points on the curve it is necessary to call
00018 c the function curv2.
00019 c
00020 c on input--
00021 c
00022 c   n is the number of values to be interpolated (n.ge.2).
00023 c
00024 c   x is an array of the n increasing abscissae of the
00025 c   functional values.
00026 c
00027 c   y is an array of the n ordinates of the values, (i. e.
00028 c   y(k) is the functional value corresponding to x(k) ).
00029 c
00030 c   slp1 and slpn contain the desired values for the first
00031 c   derivative of the curve at x(1) and x(n), respectively.
00032 c   the user may omit values for either or both of these
00033 c   parameters and signal this with islpsw.
00034 c
00035 c   islpsw contains a switch indicating which slope data
00036 c   should be used and which should be estimated by this
00037 c   subroutine,
00038 c          = 0 if slp1 and slpn are to be used,
00039 c          = 1 if slp1 is to be used but not slpn,
00040 c          = 2 if slpn is to be used but not slp1,
00041 c          = 3 if both slp1 and slpn are to be estimated
00042 c              internally.
00043 c
00044 c   yp is an array of length at least n.
00045 c
00046 c   temp is an array of length at least n which is used for
00047 c   scratch storage.
00048 c
00049 c and
00050 c
00051 c   sigma contains the tension factor. this value indicates
00052 c   the curviness desired. if abs(sigma) is nearly zero
00053 c   (e.g. .001) the resulting curve is approximately a
00054 c   cubic spline. if abs(sigma) is large (e.g. 50.) the
00055 c   resulting curve is nearly a polygonal line. if sigma
00056 c   equals zero a cubic spline results.  a standard value
00057 c   for sigma is approximately 1. in absolute value.
00058 c
00059 c on output--
00060 c
00061 c   yp contains the values of the second derivative of the
00062 c   curve at the given nodes.
00063 c
00064 c   ierr contains an error flag,
00065 c        = 0 for normal return,
00066 c        = 1 if n is less than 2,
00067 c        = 2 if x-values are not strictly increasing.
00068 c
00069 c and
00070 c
00071 c   n, x, y, slp1, slpn, islpsw and sigma are unaltered.
00072 c
00073 c this subroutine references package modules ceez, terms,
00074 c and snhcsh.
00075 c
00076 c-----------------------------------------------------------
00077 c
00078       nm1 = n-1
00079       np1 = n+1
00080       ierr = 0
00081       if (n .le. 1) go to 8
00082       if (x(n) .le. x(1)) go to 9
00083 c
00084 c denormalize tension factor
00085 c
00086       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n-1)/(x(n)-x(1))
00087 c
00088 c approximate end slopes
00089 c
00090       if (islpsw .ge. 2) go to 1
00091       slpp1 = slp1
00092       go to 2
00093     1 delx1 = x(2)-x(1)
00094       delx2 = delx1+delx1
00095       if (n .gt. 2) delx2 = x(3)-x(1)
00096       if (delx1 .le. 0. .or. delx2 .le. delx1) go to 9
00097       call ceez (delx1,delx2,sigmap,c1,c2,c3,n)
00098       slpp1 = c1*y(1)+c2*y(2)
00099       if (n .gt. 2) slpp1 = slpp1+c3*y(3)
00100     2 if (islpsw .eq. 1 .or. islpsw .eq. 3) go to 3
00101       slppn = slpn
00102       go to 4
00103     3 delxn = x(n)-x(nm1)
00104       delxnm = delxn+delxn
00105       if (n .gt. 2) delxnm = x(n)-x(n-2)
00106       if (delxn .le. 0. .or. delxnm .le. delxn) go to 9
00107       call ceez (-delxn,-delxnm,sigmap,c1,c2,c3,n)
00108       slppn = c1*y(n)+c2*y(nm1)
00109       if (n .gt. 2) slppn = slppn+c3*y(n-2)
00110 c
00111 c set up right hand side and tridiagonal system for yp and
00112 c perform forward elimination
00113 c
00114     4 delx1 = x(2)-x(1)
00115       if (delx1 .le. 0.) go to 9
00116       dx1 = (y(2)-y(1))/delx1
00117       call terms (diag1,sdiag1,sigmap,delx1)
00118       yp(1) = (dx1-slpp1)/diag1
00119       temp(1) = sdiag1/diag1
00120       if (n .eq. 2) go to 6
00121       do 5 i = 2,nm1
00122         delx2 = x(i+1)-x(i)
00123         if (delx2 .le. 0.) go to 9
00124         dx2 = (y(i+1)-y(i))/delx2
00125         call terms (diag2,sdiag2,sigmap,delx2)
00126         diag = diag1+diag2-sdiag1*temp(i-1)
00127         yp(i) = (dx2-dx1-sdiag1*yp(i-1))/diag
00128         temp(i) = sdiag2/diag
00129         dx1 = dx2
00130         diag1 = diag2
00131     5   sdiag1 = sdiag2
00132     6 diag = diag1-sdiag1*temp(nm1)
00133       yp(n) = (slppn-dx1-sdiag1*yp(nm1))/diag
00134 c
00135 c perform back substitution
00136 c
00137       do 7 i = 2,n
00138         ibak = np1-i
00139     7   yp(ibak) = yp(ibak)-temp(ibak)*yp(ibak+1)
00140       return
00141 c
00142 c too few points
00143 c
00144     8 ierr = 1
00145       return
00146 c
00147 c x-values not strictly increasing
00148 c
00149     9 ierr = 2
00150       return
00151       end
00152       subroutine curvs (n,x,y,d,isw,s,eps,ys,ysp,sigma,temp,
00153      *                  ierr)
00154 c
00155       integer n,isw,ierr
00156       real x(n),y(n),d(n),s,eps,ys(n),ysp(n),sigma,temp(n,9)
00157 c
00158 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
00159 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
00160 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
00161 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
00162 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
00163 c
00164 c this subroutine determines the parameters necessary to
00165 c compute a smoothing spline under tension. for a given
00166 c increasing sequence of abscissae (x(i)), i = 1,..., n and
00167 c associated ordinates (y(i)), i = 1,..., n, the function
00168 c determined minimizes the summation from i = 1 to n-1 of
00169 c the square of the second derivative of f plus sigma
00170 c squared times the difference of the first derivative of f
00171 c and (f(x(i+1))-f(x(i)))/(x(i+1)-x(i)) squared, over all
00172 c functions f with two continuous derivatives such that the
00173 c summation of the square of (f(x(i))-y(i))/d(i) is less
00174 c than or equal to a given constant s, where (d(i)), i = 1,
00175 c ..., n are a given set of observation weights. the
00176 c function determined is a spline under tension with third
00177 c derivative discontinuities at (x(i)), i = 2,..., n-1. for
00178 c actual computation of points on the curve it is necessary
00179 c to call the function curv2. the determination of the curve
00180 c is performed by subroutine curvss, the subroutine curvs
00181 c only decomposes the workspace for curvss.
00182 c
00183 c on input--
00184 c
00185 c   n is the number of values to be smoothed (n.ge.2).
00186 c
00187 c   x is an array of the n increasing abscissae of the
00188 c   values to be smoothed.
00189 c
00190 c   y is an array of the n ordinates of the values to be
00191 c   smoothed, (i. e. y(k) is the functional value
00192 c   corresponding to x(k) ).
00193 c
00194 c   d is a parameter containing the observation weights.
00195 c   this may either be an array of length n or a scalar
00196 c   (interpreted as a constant). the value of d
00197 c   corresponding to the observation (x(k),y(k)) should
00198 c   be an approximation to the standard deviation of error.
00199 c
00200 c   isw contains a switch indicating whether the parameter
00201 c   d is to be considered a vector or a scalar,
00202 c          = 0 if d is an array of length n,
00203 c          = 1 if d is a scalar.
00204 c
00205 c   s contains the value controlling the smoothing. this
00206 c   must be non-negative. for s equal to zero, the
00207 c   subroutine does interpolation, larger values lead to
00208 c   smoother funtions. if parameter d contains standard
00209 c   deviation estimates, a reasonable value for s is
00210 c   float(n).
00211 c
00212 c   eps contains a tolerance on the relative precision to
00213 c   which s is to be interpreted. this must be greater than
00214 c   or equal to zero and less than or equal to one. a
00215 c   reasonable value for eps is sqrt(2./float(n)).
00216 c
00217 c   ys is an array of length at least n.
00218 c
00219 c   ysp is an array of length at least n.
00220 c
00221 c   sigma contains the tension factor. this value indicates
00222 c   the degree to which the first derivative part of the
00223 c   smoothing functional is emphasized. if sigma is nearly
00224 c   zero (e. g. .001) the resulting curve is approximately a
00225 c   cubic spline. if sigma is large (e. g. 50.) the
00226 c   resulting curve is nearly a polygonal line. if sigma
00227 c   equals zero a cubic spline results. a standard value for
00228 c   sigma is approximately 1.
00229 c
00230 c and
00231 c
00232 c   temp is an array of length at least 9*n which is used
00233 c   for scratch storage.
00234 c
00235 c on output--
00236 c
00237 c   ys contains the smoothed ordinate values.
00238 c
00239 c   ysp contains the values of the second derivative of the
00240 c   smoothed curve at the given nodes.
00241 c
00242 c   ierr contains an error flag,
00243 c        = 0 for normal return,
00244 c        = 1 if n is less than 2,
00245 c        = 2 if s is negative,
00246 c        = 3 if eps is negative or greater than one,
00247 c        = 4 if x-values are not strictly increasing,
00248 c        = 5 if a d-value is non-positive.
00249 c
00250 c and
00251 c
00252 c   n, x, y, d, isw, s, eps, and sigma are unaltered.
00253 c
00254 c this subroutine references package modules curvss, terms,
00255 c and snhcsh.
00256 c
00257 c-----------------------------------------------------------
00258 c
00259 c decompose temp into nine arrays and call curvss
00260 c
00261       call curvss (n,x,y,d,isw,s,eps,ys,ysp,sigma,temp(1,1),
00262      *             temp(1,2),temp(1,3),temp(1,4),temp(1,5),
00263      *             temp(1,6),temp(1,7),temp(1,8),temp(1,9),
00264      *             ierr)
00265       return
00266       end
00267       function curv2 (t,n,x,y,yp,sigma)
00268 c
00269       integer n
00270       real t,x(n),y(n),yp(n),sigma
00271 c
00272 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
00273 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
00274 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
00275 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
00276 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
00277 c
00278 c this function interpolates a curve at a given point
00279 c using a spline under tension. the subroutine curv1 should
00280 c be called earlier to determine certain necessary
00281 c parameters.
00282 c
00283 c on input--
00284 c
00285 c   t contains a real value to be mapped onto the interpo-
00286 c   lating curve.
00287 c
00288 c   n contains the number of points which were specified to
00289 c   determine the curve.
00290 c
00291 c   x and y are arrays containing the abscissae and
00292 c   ordinates, respectively, of the specified points.
00293 c
00294 c   yp is an array of second derivative values of the curve
00295 c   at the nodes.
00296 c
00297 c and
00298 c
00299 c   sigma contains the tension factor (its sign is ignored).
00300 c
00301 c the parameters n, x, y, yp, and sigma should be input
00302 c unaltered from the output of curv1.
00303 c
00304 c on output--
00305 c
00306 c   curv2 contains the interpolated value.
00307 c
00308 c none of the input parameters are altered.
00309 c
00310 c this function references package modules intrvl and
00311 c snhcsh.
00312 c
00313 c-----------------------------------------------------------
00314 c
00315 c determine interval
00316 c
00317       im1 = intrvl(t,x,n)
00318       i = im1+1
00319 c
00320 c denormalize tension factor
00321 c
00322       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n-1)/(x(n)-x(1))
00323 c
00324 c set up and perform interpolation
00325 c
00326       del1 = t-x(im1)
00327       del2 = x(i)-t
00328       dels = x(i)-x(im1)
00329       sum = (y(i)*del1+y(im1)*del2)/dels
00330       if (sigmap .ne. 0.) go to 1
00331       curv2 = sum-del1*del2*(yp(i)*(del1+dels)+yp(im1)*
00332      *        (del2+dels))/(6.*dels)
00333       return
00334     1 sigdel = sigmap*dels
00335       call snhcsh (ss,dummy,sigdel,-1)
00336       call snhcsh (s1,dummy,sigmap*del1,-1)
00337       call snhcsh (s2,dummy,sigmap*del2,-1)
00338       curv2 = sum+(yp(i)*del1*(s1-ss)+yp(im1)*del2*(s2-ss))/
00339      *            (sigdel*sigmap*(1.+ss))
00340       return
00341       end
00342       function curvd (t,n,x,y,yp,sigma)
00343 c
00344       integer n
00345       real t,x(n),y(n),yp(n),sigma
00346 c
00347 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
00348 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
00349 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
00350 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
00351 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
00352 c
00353 c this function differentiates a curve at a given point
00354 c using a spline under tension. the subroutine curv1 should
00355 c be called earlier to determine certain necessary
00356 c parameters.
00357 c
00358 c on input--
00359 c
00360 c   t contains a real value at which the derivative is to be
00361 c   determined.
00362 c
00363 c   n contains the number of points which were specified to
00364 c   determine the curve.
00365 c
00366 c   x and y are arrays containing the abscissae and
00367 c   ordinates, respectively, of the specified points.
00368 c
00369 c   yp is an array of second derivative values of the curve
00370 c   at the nodes.
00371 c
00372 c and
00373 c
00374 c   sigma contains the tension factor (its sign is ignored).
00375 c
00376 c the parameters n, x, y, yp, and sigma should be input
00377 c unaltered from the output of curv1.
00378 c
00379 c on output--
00380 c
00381 c   curvd contains the derivative value.
00382 c
00383 c none of the input parameters are altered.
00384 c
00385 c this function references package modules intrvl and
00386 c snhcsh.
00387 c
00388 c-----------------------------------------------------------
00389 c
00390 c determine interval
00391 c
00392       im1 = intrvl(t,x,n)
00393       i = im1+1
00394 c
00395 c denormalize tension factor
00396 c
00397       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n-1)/(x(n)-x(1))
00398 c
00399 c set up and perform differentiation
00400 c
00401       del1 = t-x(im1)
00402       del2 = x(i)-t
00403       dels = x(i)-x(im1)
00404       sum = (y(i)-y(im1))/dels
00405       if (sigmap .ne. 0.) go to 1
00406       curvd = sum+(yp(i)*(2.*del1*del1-del2*(del1+dels))-
00407      *             yp(im1)*(2.*del2*del2-del1*(del2+dels)))
00408      *             /(6.*dels)
00409       return
00410     1 sigdel = sigmap*dels
00411       call snhcsh (ss,dummy,sigdel,-1)
00412       call snhcsh (dummy,c1,sigmap*del1,1)
00413       call snhcsh (dummy,c2,sigmap*del2,1)
00414       curvd = sum+(yp(i)*(c1-ss)-yp(im1)*(c2-ss))/
00415      *        (sigdel*sigmap*(1.+ss))
00416       return
00417       end
00418       function curvi (xl,xu,n,x,y,yp,sigma)
00419 c
00420       integer n
00421       real xl,xu,x(n),y(n),yp(n),sigma
00422 c
00423 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
00424 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
00425 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
00426 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
00427 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
00428 c
00429 c this function integrates a curve specified by a spline
00430 c under tension between two given limits. the subroutine
00431 c curv1 should be called earlier to determine necessary
00432 c parameters.
00433 c
00434 c on input--
00435 c
00436 c   xl and xu contain the upper and lower limits of inte-
00437 c   gration, respectively. (sl need not be less than or
00438 c   equal to xu, curvi (xl,xu,...) .eq. -curvi (xu,xl,...) ).
00439 c
00440 c   n contains the number of points which were specified to
00441 c   determine the curve.
00442 c
00443 c   x and y are arrays containing the abscissae and
00444 c   ordinates, respectively, of the specified points.
00445 c
00446 c   yp is an array from subroutine curv1 containing
00447 c   the values of the second derivatives at the nodes.
00448 c
00449 c and
00450 c
00451 c   sigma contains the tension factor (its sign is ignored).
00452 c
00453 c the parameters n, x, y, yp, and sigma should be input
00454 c unaltered from the output of curv1.
00455 c
00456 c on output--
00457 c
00458 c   curvi contains the integral value.
00459 c
00460 c none of the input parameters are altered.
00461 c
00462 c this function references package modules intrvl and
00463 c snhcsh.
00464 c
00465 c-----------------------------------------------------------
00466 c
00467 c denormalize tension factor
00468 c
00469       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n-1)/(x(n)-x(1))
00470 c
00471 c determine actual upper and lower bounds
00472 c
00473       xxl = xl
00474       xxu = xu
00475       ssign = 1.
00476       if (xl .lt. xu) go to 1
00477       xxl = xu
00478       xxu = xl
00479       ssign = -1.
00480       if (xl .gt. xu) go to 1
00481 c
00482 c return zero if xl .eq. xu
00483 c
00484       curvi = 0.
00485       return
00486 c
00487 c search for proper intervals
00488 c
00489     1 ilm1 = intrvl (xxl,x,n)
00490       il = ilm1+1
00491       ium1 = intrvl (xxu,x,n)
00492       iu = ium1+1
00493       if (il .eq. iu) go to 8
00494 c
00495 c integrate from xxl to x(il)
00496 c
00497       sum = 0.
00498       if (xxl .eq. x(il)) go to 3
00499       del1 = xxl-x(ilm1)
00500       del2 = x(il)-xxl
00501       dels = x(il)-x(ilm1)
00502       t1 = (del1+dels)*del2/(2.*dels)
00503       t2 = del2*del2/(2.*dels)
00504       sum = t1*y(il)+t2*y(ilm1)
00505       if (sigma .eq. 0.) go to 2
00506       call snhcsh (dummy,c1,sigmap*del1,2)
00507       call snhcsh (dummy,c2,sigmap*del2,2)
00508       call snhcsh (ss,cs,sigmap*dels,3)
00509       sum = sum+((dels*dels*(cs-ss/2.)-del1*del1*(c1-ss/2.))
00510      *           *yp(il)+del2*del2*(c2-ss/2.)*yp(ilm1))/
00511      *          (sigmap*sigmap*dels*(1.+ss))
00512       go to 3
00513     2 sum = sum-t1*t1*dels*yp(il)/6.
00514      *         -t2*(del1*(del2+dels)+dels*dels)*yp(ilm1)/12.
00515 c
00516 c integrate over interior intervals
00517 c
00518     3 if (iu-il .eq. 1) go to 6
00519       ilp1 = il+1
00520       do 5 i = ilp1,ium1
00521         dels = x(i)-x(i-1)
00522         sum = sum+(y(i)+y(i-1))*dels/2.
00523         if (sigma .eq. 0.) go to 4
00524         call snhcsh (ss,cs,sigmap*dels,3)
00525         sum = sum+(yp(i)+yp(i-1))*dels*(cs-ss/2.)/
00526      *            (sigmap*sigmap*(1.+ss))
00527         go to 5
00528     4   sum = sum-(yp(i)+yp(i-1))*dels*dels*dels/24.
00529     5   continue
00530 c
00531 c integrate from x(iu-1) to xxu
00532 c
00533     6 if (xxu .eq. x(ium1)) go to 10
00534       del1 = xxu-x(ium1)
00535       del2 = x(iu)-xxu
00536       dels = x(iu)-x(ium1)
00537       t1 = del1*del1/(2.*dels)
00538       t2 = (del2+dels)*del1/(2.*dels)
00539       sum = sum+t1*y(iu)+t2*y(ium1)
00540       if (sigma .eq. 0.) go to 7
00541       call snhcsh (dummy,c1,sigmap*del1,2)
00542       call snhcsh (dummy,c2,sigmap*del2,2)
00543       call snhcsh (ss,cs,sigmap*dels,3)
00544       sum = sum+(yp(iu)*del1*del1*(c1-ss/2.)+yp(ium1)*
00545      *          (dels*dels*(cs-ss/2.)-del2*del2*(c2-ss/2.)))
00546      *         /(sigmap*sigmap*dels*(1.+ss))
00547       go to 10
00548     7 sum = sum-t1*(del2*(del1+dels)+dels*dels)*yp(iu)/12.
00549      *         -t2*t2*dels*yp(ium1)/6.
00550       go to 10
00551 c
00552 c integrate from xxl to xxu
00553 c
00554     8 delu1 = xxu-x(ium1)
00555       delu2 = x(iu)-xxu
00556       dell1 = xxl-x(ium1)
00557       dell2 = x(iu)-xxl
00558       dels = x(iu)-x(ium1)
00559       deli = xxu-xxl
00560       t1 = (delu1+dell1)*deli/(2.*dels)
00561       t2 = (delu2+dell2)*deli/(2.*dels)
00562       sum = t1*y(iu)+t2*y(ium1)
00563       if (sigma .eq. 0.) go to 9
00564       call snhcsh (dummy,cu1,sigmap*delu1,2)
00565       call snhcsh (dummy,cu2,sigmap*delu2,2)
00566       call snhcsh (dummy,cl1,sigmap*dell1,2)
00567       call snhcsh (dummy,cl2,sigmap*dell2,2)
00568       call snhcsh (ss,dummy,sigmap*dels,-1)
00569       sum = sum+(yp(iu)*(delu1*delu1*(cu1-ss/2.)
00570      *            -dell1*dell1*(cl1-ss/2.))
00571      *          +yp(ium1)*(dell2*dell2*(cl2-ss/2.)
00572      *            -delu2*delu2*(cu2-ss/2.)))/
00573      *          (sigmap*sigmap*dels*(1.+ss))
00574       go to 10
00575     9 sum = sum-t1*(delu2*(dels+delu1)+dell2*(dels+dell1))*
00576      *             yp(iu)/12.
00577      *         -t2*(dell1*(dels+dell2)+delu1*(dels+delu2))*
00578      *             yp(ium1)/12.
00579 c
00580 c correct sign and return
00581 c
00582    10 curvi = ssign*sum
00583       return
00584       end
00585       subroutine curvp1 (n,x,y,p,yp,temp,sigma,ierr)
00586 c
00587       integer n,ierr
00588       real x(n),y(n),p,yp(n),temp(1),sigma
00589 c
00590 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
00591 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
00592 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
00593 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
00594 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
00595 c
00596 c this subroutine determines the parameters necessary to
00597 c compute a periodic interpolatory spline under tension
00598 c through a sequence of functional values. for actual ends
00599 c of the curve may be specified or omitted.  for actual
00600 c computation of points on the curve it is necessary to call
00601 c the function curvp2.
00602 c
00603 c on input--
00604 c
00605 c   n is the number of values to be interpolated (n.ge.2).
00606 c
00607 c   x is an array of the n increasing abscissae of the
00608 c   functional values.
00609 c
00610 c   y is an array of the n ordinates of the values, (i. e.
00611 c   y(k) is the functional value corresponding to x(k) ).
00612 c
00613 c   p is the period (p .gt. x(n)-x(1)).
00614 c
00615 c   yp is an array of length at least n.
00616 c
00617 c   temp is an array of length at least 2*n which is used
00618 c   for scratch storage.
00619 c
00620 c and
00621 c
00622 c   sigma contains the tension factor.  this value indicates
00623 c   the curviness desired. if abs(sigma) is nearly zero
00624 c   (e.g. .001) the resulting curve is approximately a
00625 c   cubic spline. if abs(sigma) is large (e.g. 50.) the
00626 c   resulting curve is nearly a polygonal line. if sigma
00627 c   equals zero a cubic spline results.  a standard value
00628 c   for sigma is approximately 1. in absolute value.
00629 c
00630 c on output--
00631 c
00632 c   yp contains the values of the second derivative of the
00633 c   curve at the given nodes.
00634 c
00635 c   ierr contains an error flag,
00636 c        = 0 for normal return,
00637 c        = 1 if n is less than 2,
00638 c        = 2 if p is less than or equal to x(n)-x(1),
00639 c        = 3 if x-values are not strictly increasing.
00640 c
00641 c and
00642 c
00643 c  n, x, y, and sigma are unaltered.
00644 c
00645 c this subroutine references package modules terms and
00646 c snhcsh.
00647 c
00648 c-----------------------------------------------------------
00649 c
00650       nm1 = n-1
00651       np1 = n+1
00652       ierr = 0
00653       if (n .le. 1) go to 6
00654       if (p .le. x(n)-x(1) .or. p .le. 0.) go to 7
00655 c
00656 c denormalize tension factor
00657 c
00658       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n)/p
00659 c
00660 c set up right hand side and tridiagonal system for yp and
00661 c perform forward elimination
00662 c
00663       delx1 = p-(x(n)-x(1))
00664       dx1 = (y(1)-y(n))/delx1
00665       call terms (diag1,sdiag1,sigmap,delx1)
00666       delx2 = x(2)-x(1)
00667       if (delx2 .le. 0.) go to 8
00668       dx2 = (y(2)-y(1))/delx2
00669       call terms (diag2,sdiag2,sigmap,delx2)
00670       diag = diag1+diag2
00671       yp(1) = (dx2-dx1)/diag
00672       temp(np1) = -sdiag1/diag
00673       temp(1) = sdiag2/diag
00674       dx1 = dx2
00675       diag1 = diag2
00676       sdiag1 = sdiag2
00677       if (n .eq. 2) go to 2
00678       do 1 i = 2,nm1
00679         npi = n+i
00680         delx2 = x(i+1)-x(i)
00681         if (delx2 .le. 0.) go to 8
00682         dx2 = (y(i+1)-y(i))/delx2
00683         call terms (diag2,sdiag2,sigmap,delx2)
00684         diag = diag1+diag2-sdiag1*temp(i-1)
00685         yp(i) = (dx2-dx1-sdiag1*yp(i-1))/diag
00686         temp(npi) = -temp(npi-1)*sdiag1/diag
00687         temp(i) = sdiag2/diag
00688         dx1 = dx2
00689         diag1 = diag2
00690     1   sdiag1 = sdiag2
00691     2 delx2 = p-(x(n)-x(1))
00692       dx2 = (y(1)-y(n))/delx2
00693       call terms (diag2,sdiag2,sigmap,delx2)
00694       yp(n) = dx2-dx1
00695       temp(nm1) = temp(2*n-1)-temp(nm1)
00696       if (n .eq. 2) go to 4
00697 c
00698 c perform first step of back substitution
00699 c
00700       do 3 i = 3,n
00701         ibak = np1-i
00702         npibak =n+ibak
00703         yp(ibak) = yp(ibak)-temp(ibak)*yp(ibak+1)
00704     3   temp(ibak) =temp(npibak)-temp(ibak)*temp(ibak+1)
00705     4 yp(n) = (yp(n)-sdiag2*yp(1)-sdiag1*yp(nm1))/
00706      *        (diag1+diag2+sdiag2*temp(1)+sdiag1*temp(nm1))
00707 c
00708 c perform second step of back substitution
00709 c
00710       ypn =   yp(n)
00711       do 5 i = 1,nm1
00712     5    yp(i) = yp(i)+temp(i)*ypn
00713       return
00714 c
00715 c too few points
00716 c
00717     6 ierr = 1
00718       return
00719 c
00720 c period too small
00721 c
00722     7 ierr = 2
00723       return
00724 c
00725 c x-values not strictly increasing
00726 c
00727     8 ierr = 3
00728       return
00729       end
00730       subroutine curvps (n,x,y,p,d,isw,s,eps,ys,ysp,sigma,
00731      *                   temp,ierr)
00732 c
00733       integer n,isw,ierr
00734       real x(n),y(n),p,d(n),s,eps,ys(n),ysp(n),sigma,
00735      *     temp(n,11)
00736 c
00737 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
00738 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
00739 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
00740 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
00741 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
00742 c
00743 c this subroutine determines the parameters necessary to
00744 c compute a periodic smoothing spline under tension. for a
00745 c given increasing sequence of abscissae (x(i)), i = 1,...,n
00746 c and associated ordinates (y(i)), i = 1,...,n, letting p be
00747 c the period, x(n+1) = x(1)+p, and y(n+1) = y(1), the
00748 c function determined minimizes the summation from i = 1 to
00749 c n of the square of the second derivative of f plus sigma
00750 c squared times the difference of the first derivative of f
00751 c and (f(x(i+1))-f(x(i)))/(x(i+1)-x(i)) squared, over all
00752 c functions f with period p and two continuous derivatives
00753 c such that the summation of the square of
00754 c (f(x(i))-y(i))/d(i) is less than or equal to a given
00755 c constant s, where (d(i)), i = 1,...,n are a given set of
00756 c observation weights. the function determined is a periodic
00757 c spline under tension with third derivative discontinuities
00758 c at (x(i)) i = 1,...,n (and all periodic translations of
00759 c these values). for actual computation of points on the
00760 c curve it is necessary to call the function curvp2. the
00761 c determination of the curve is performed by subroutine
00762 c curvpp, the subroutin curvps only decomposes the workspace
00763 c for curvpp.
00764 c
00765 c on input--
00766 c
00767 c   n is the number of values to be smoothed (n.ge.2).
00768 c
00769 c   x is an array of the n increasing abscissae of the
00770 c   values to be smoothed.
00771 c
00772 c   y is an array of the n ordinates of the values to be
00773 c   smoothed, (i. e. y(k) is the functional value
00774 c   corresponding to x(k) ).
00775 c
00776 c   p is the period (p .gt. x(n)-x(1)).
00777 c
00778 c   d is a parameter containing the observation weights.
00779 c   this may either be an array of length n or a scalar
00780 c   (interpreted as a constant). the value of d
00781 c   corresponding to the observation (x(k),y(k)) should
00782 c   be an approximation to the standard deviation of error.
00783 c
00784 c   isw contains a switch indicating whether the parameter
00785 c   d is to be considered a vector or a scalar,
00786 c          = 0 if d is an array of length n,
00787 c          = 1 if d is a scalar.
00788 c
00789 c   s contains the value controlling the smoothing. this
00790 c   must be non-negative. for s equal to zero, the
00791 c   subroutine does interpolation, larger values lead to
00792 c   smoother funtions. if parameter d contains standard
00793 c   deviation estimates, a reasonable value for s is
00794 c   float(n).
00795 c
00796 c   eps contains a tolerance on the relative precision to
00797 c   which s is to be interpreted. this must be greater than
00798 c   or equal to zero and less than or equal to one. a
00799 c   reasonable value for eps is sqrt(2./float(n)).
00800 c
00801 c   ys is an array of length at least n.
00802 c
00803 c   ysp is an array of length at least n.
00804 c
00805 c   sigma contains the tension factor. this value indicates
00806 c   the degree to which the first derivative part of the
00807 c   smoothing functional is emphasized. if sigma is nearly
00808 c   zero (e. g. .001) the resulting curve is approximately a
00809 c   cubic spline. if sigma is large (e. g. 50.) the
00810 c   resulting curve is nearly a polygonal line. if sigma
00811 c   equals zero a cubic spline results. a standard value for
00812 c   sigma is approximately 1.
00813 c
00814 c and
00815 c
00816 c   temp is an array of length at least 11*n which is used
00817 c   for scratch storage.
00818 c
00819 c on output--
00820 c
00821 c   ys contains the smoothed ordinate values.
00822 c
00823 c   ysp contains the values of the second derivative of the
00824 c   smoothed curve at the given nodes.
00825 c
00826 c   ierr contains an error flag,
00827 c        = 0 for normal return,
00828 c        = 1 if n is less than 2,
00829 c        = 2 if s is negative,
00830 c        = 3 if eps is negative or greater than one,
00831 c        = 4 if x-values are not strictly increasing,
00832 c        = 5 if a d-value is non-positive,
00833 c        = 6 if p is less than or equal to x(n)-x(1).
00834 c
00835 c and
00836 c
00837 c   n, x, y, p, d, isw, s, eps, and sigma are unaltered.
00838 c
00839 c this subroutine references package modules curvpp, terms,
00840 c and snhcsh.
00841 c
00842 c-----------------------------------------------------------
00843 c
00844 c decompose temp into eleven arrays and call curvpp
00845 c
00846       call curvpp (n,x,y,p,d,isw,s,eps,ys,ysp,sigma,
00847      *             temp(1,1),temp(1,2),temp(1,3),temp(1,4),
00848      *             temp(1,5),temp(1,6),temp(1,7),temp(1,8),
00849      *             temp(1,9),temp(1,10),temp(1,11),ierr)
00850       return
00851       end
00852       function curvp2 (t,n,x,y,p,yp,sigma)
00853 c
00854       integer n
00855       real t,x(n),y(n),p,yp(n),sigma
00856 c
00857 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
00858 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
00859 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
00860 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
00861 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
00862 c
00863 c this function interpolates a curve at a given point using
00864 c a periodic spline under tension. the subroutine curvp1
00865 c should be called earlier to determine certain necessary
00866 c parameters.
00867 c
00868 c on input--
00869 c
00870 c   t contains a real value to be mapped onto the interpo-
00871 c   lating curve.
00872 c
00873 c   n contains the number of points which were specified to
00874 c   determine the curve.
00875 c
00876 c   x and y are arrays containing the abscissae and
00877 c   ordinates, respectively, of the specified points.
00878 c
00879 c   p contains the period.
00880 c
00881 c   yp is an array of second derivative values of the curve
00882 c   at the nodes.
00883 c
00884 c and
00885 c
00886 c   sigma contains the tension factor (its sign is ignored).
00887 c
00888 c the parameters n, x, y, p, yp, and sigma should be input
00889 c unaltered from the output of curvp1.
00890 c
00891 c on output--
00892 c
00893 c   curvp2 contains the interpolated value.
00894 c
00895 c none of the input parameters are altered.
00896 c
00897 c this function references package modules intrvp and
00898 c snhcsh.
00899 c
00900 c-----------------------------------------------------------
00901 c
00902 c determine interval
00903 c
00904       im1 = intrvp (t,x,n,p,tp)
00905       i = im1+1
00906 c
00907 c denormalize tension factor
00908 c
00909       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n)/p
00910 c
00911 c set up and perform interpolation
00912 c
00913       del1 = tp-x(im1)
00914       if (im1 .eq. n) go to 1
00915       del2 = x(i)-tp
00916       dels = x(i)-x(im1)
00917       go to 2
00918     1 i = 1
00919       del2 = x(1)+p-tp
00920       dels = p-(x(n)-x(1))
00921     2 sum = (y(i)*del1+y(im1)*del2)/dels
00922       if (sigmap .ne. 0.) go to 3
00923       curvp2 = sum-del1*del2*(yp(i)*(del1+dels)+yp(im1)*
00924      *        (del2+dels))/(6.*dels)
00925       return
00926     3 sigdel = sigmap*dels
00927       call snhcsh (ss,dummy,sigdel,-1)
00928       call snhcsh (s1,dummy,sigmap*del1,-1)
00929       call snhcsh (s2,dummy,sigmap*del2,-1)
00930       curvp2 = sum+(yp(i)*del1*(s1-ss)+yp(im1)*del2*(s2-ss))/
00931      *            (sigdel*sigmap*(1.+ss))
00932       return
00933       end
00934       function curvpi (xl,xu,n,x,y,p,yp,sigma)
00935 c
00936       integer n
00937       real xl,xu,x(n),y(n),p,yp(n),sigma
00938 c
00939 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
00940 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
00941 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
00942 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
00943 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
00944 c
00945 c this function integrates a curve specified by a periodic
00946 c spline under tension between two given limits. the
00947 c subroutine curvp1 should be called earlier to determine
00948 c necessary parameters.
00949 c
00950 c on input--
00951 c
00952 c   xl and xu contain the upper and lower limits of inte-
00953 c   gration, respectively. (sl need not be less than or
00954 c   equal to xu, curvpi (xl,xu,...) .eq. -curvpi (xu,xl,...) ).
00955 c
00956 c   n contains the number of points which were specified to
00957 c   determine the curve.
00958 c
00959 c   x and y are arrays containing the abscissae and
00960 c   ordinates, respectively, of the specified points.
00961 c
00962 c   p contains the period.
00963 c
00964 c   yp is an array from subroutine curvp1 containing
00965 c   the values of the second derivatives at the nodes.
00966 c
00967 c and
00968 c
00969 c   sigma contains the tension factor (its sign is ignored).
00970 c
00971 c the parameters n, x, y, p, yp, and sigma should be input
00972 c unaltered from the output of curvp1.
00973 c
00974 c on output--
00975 c
00976 c
00977 c   curvpi contains the integral value.
00978 c
00979 c none of the input parameters are altered.
00980 c
00981 c this function references package modules intrvp and
00982 c snhcsh.
00983 c
00984 c--------------------------------------------------------------
00985 c
00986       integer uper
00987       logical bdy
00988 c
00989 c denormalize tension factor
00990 c
00991       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n)/p
00992 c
00993 c determine actual upper and lower bounds
00994 c
00995       x1pp = x(1)+p
00996       isign = 1
00997       ilm1 = intrvp (xl,x,n,p,xxl)
00998       lper = int((xl-x(1))/p)
00999       if (xl .lt. x(1)) lper = lper-1
01000       ium1 = intrvp (xu,x,n,p,xxu)
01001       uper = int((xu-x(1))/p)
01002       if (xu .lt. x(1)) uper = uper-1
01003       ideltp = uper-lper
01004       bdy = float(ideltp)*(xxu-xxl) .lt. 0.
01005       if ((ideltp .eq. 0 .and. xxu .lt. xxl) .or.
01006      *    ideltp .lt. 0) isign = -1
01007       if (bdy) ideltp = ideltp-isign
01008       if (xxu .ge. xxl) go to 1
01009       xsave = xxl
01010       xxl = xxu
01011       xxu = xsave
01012       isave = ilm1
01013       ilm1 = ium1
01014       ium1 = isave
01015     1 il = ilm1+1
01016       if (ilm1 .eq. n) il = 1
01017       xil = x(il)
01018       if (ilm1 .eq. n) xil = x1pp
01019       iu = ium1+1
01020       if (ium1 .eq. n) iu = 1
01021       xiu = x(iu)
01022       if (ium1 .eq. n) xiu = x1pp
01023       s1 = 0.
01024       if (ilm1 .eq. 1 .or. (ideltp .eq. 0 .and.
01025      *    .not. bdy)) go to 4
01026 c
01027 c integrate from x(1) to x(ilm1), store in s1
01028 c
01029       do 3 i = 2,ilm1
01030         dels = x(i)-x(i-1)
01031         s1 = s1+(y(i)+y(i-1))*dels/2.
01032         if (sigma .eq. 0.) go to 2
01033         call snhcsh (ss,cs,sigmap*dels,3)
01034         s1 = s1+(yp(i)+yp(i-1))*dels*(cs-ss/2.)/
01035      *            (sigmap*sigmap*(1.+ss))
01036         go to 3
01037     2   s1 = s1-(yp(i)+yp(i-1))*dels*dels*dels/24.
01038     3   continue
01039     4 s2 = 0.
01040       if (x(ilm1) .ge. xxl .or. (ideltp .eq. 0
01041      *    .and. .not. bdy)) go to 6
01042 c
01043 c integrate from x(ilm1) to xxl, store in s2
01044 c
01045       del1 = xxl-x(ilm1)
01046       del2 = xil-xxl
01047       dels = xil-x(ilm1)
01048       t1 = del1*del1/(2.*dels)
01049       t2 = (del2+dels)*del1/(2.*dels)
01050       s2 = t1*y(il)+t2*y(ilm1)
01051       if (sigma .eq. 0.) go to 5
01052       call snhcsh (dummy,c1,sigmap*del1,2)
01053       call snhcsh (dummy,c2,sigmap*del2,2)
01054       call snhcsh (ss,cs,sigmap*dels,3)
01055       s2 = s2+(yp(il)*del1*del1*(c1-ss/2.)+yp(ilm1)*
01056      *          (dels*dels*(cs-ss/2.)-del2*del2*(c2-ss/2.)))
01057      *         /(sigmap*sigmap*dels*(1.+ss))
01058       go to 6
01059     5 s2 = s2-t1*(del2*(del1+dels)
01060      *     +dels*dels)*yp(il)/12.
01061      *     -t2*t2*dels*yp(ilm1)/6.
01062     6 s3 = 0.
01063       if (xxl .ge. xil .or. (ideltp .eq. 0 .and. bdy)
01064      *    .or. ilm1 .eq. ium1) go to 8
01065 c
01066 c integrate from xxl to xil, store in s3
01067 c
01068       del1 = xxl-x(ilm1)
01069       del2 = xil-xxl
01070       dels = xil-x(ilm1)
01071       t1 = (del1+dels)*del2/(2.*dels)
01072       t2 = del2*del2/(2.*dels)
01073       s3 = t1*y(il)+t2*y(ilm1)
01074       if (sigma .eq. 0.) go to 7
01075       call snhcsh (dummy,c1,sigmap*del1,2)
01076       call snhcsh (dummy,c2,sigmap*del2,2)
01077       call snhcsh (ss,cs,sigmap*dels,3)
01078       s3 = s3+((dels*dels*(cs-ss/2.)-del1*del1*(c1-ss/2.))
01079      *           *yp(il)+del2*del2*(c2-ss/2.)*yp(ilm1))/
01080      *          (sigmap*sigmap*dels*(1.+ss))
01081       go to 8
01082     7 s3 = s3-t1*t1*dels*yp(il)/6.
01083      *     -t2*(del1*(del2+dels)+dels*dels)*
01084      *     yp(ilm1)/12.
01085     8 s4 = 0.
01086       if (ilm1 .ge. ium1-1 .or. (ideltp .eq. 0 .and. bdy))
01087      *   go to 11
01088 c
01089 c integrate from xil to x(ium1), store in s4
01090 c
01091       ilp1 = il+1
01092       do 10 i = ilp1,ium1
01093         dels = x(i)-x(i-1)
01094         s4 = s4+(y(i)+y(i-1))*dels/2.
01095         if (sigma .eq. 0.) go to 9
01096         call snhcsh (ss,cs,sigmap*dels,3)
01097         s4 = s4+(yp(i)+yp(i-1))*dels*(cs-ss/2.)/
01098      *            (sigmap*sigmap*(1.+ss))
01099         go to 10
01100     9   s4 = s4-(yp(i)+yp(i-1))*dels*dels*dels/24.
01101    10   continue
01102    11 s5 = 0.
01103       if (x(ium1) .ge. xxu .or. (ideltp .eq. 0 .and. bdy)
01104      *    .or. ilm1 .eq. ium1) go to 13
01105 c
01106 c integrate from x(ium1) to xxu, store in s5
01107 c
01108       del1 = xxu-x(ium1)
01109       del2 = xiu-xxu
01110       dels = xiu-x(ium1)
01111       t1 = del1*del1/(2.*dels)
01112       t2 = (del2+dels)*del1/(2.*dels)
01113       s5 = t1*y(iu)+t2*y(ium1)
01114       if (sigma .eq. 0.) go to 12
01115       call snhcsh (dummy,c1,sigmap*del1,2)
01116       call snhcsh (dummy,c2,sigmap*del2,2)
01117       call snhcsh (ss,cs,sigmap*dels,3)
01118       s5 = s5+(yp(iu)*del1*del1*(c1-ss/2.)+yp(ium1)*
01119      *          (dels*dels*(cs-ss/2.)-del2*del2*(c2-ss/2.)))
01120      *         /(sigmap*sigmap*dels*(1.+ss))
01121       go to 13
01122    12 s5 = s5-t1*(del2*(del1+dels)
01123      *     +dels*dels)*yp(iu)/12.
01124      *     -t2*t2*dels*yp(ium1)/6.
01125    13 s6 = 0.
01126       if (xxu .ge. xiu .or. (ideltp .eq. 0 .and.
01127      *    .not. bdy)) go to 15
01128 c
01129 c integrate from xxu to xiu, store in s6
01130 c
01131       del1 = xxu-x(ium1)
01132       del2 = xiu-xxu
01133       dels = xiu-x(ium1)
01134       t1 = (del1+dels)*del2/(2.*dels)
01135       t2 = del2*del2/(2.*dels)
01136       s6 = t1*y(iu)+t2*y(ium1)
01137       if (sigma .eq. 0.) go to 14
01138       call snhcsh (dummy,c1,sigmap*del1,2)
01139       call snhcsh (dummy,c2,sigmap*del2,2)
01140       call snhcsh (ss,cs,sigmap*dels,3)
01141       s6 = s6+((dels*dels*(cs-ss/2.)-del1*del1*(c1-ss/2.))
01142      *           *yp(iu)+del2*del2*(c2-ss/2.)*yp(ium1))/
01143      *          (sigmap*sigmap*dels*(1.+ss))
01144       go to 15
01145    14 s6 = s6-t1*t1*dels*yp(iu)/6.
01146      *     -t2*(del1*(del2+dels)+dels*dels)*
01147      *     yp(ium1)/12.
01148    15 s7 = 0.
01149       if (iu .eq. 1 .or. (ideltp .eq. 0 .and. .not. bdy))
01150      *    go to 18
01151 c
01152 c integrate from xiu to x1pp, store in s7
01153 c
01154       np1 = n+1
01155       iup1 = iu+1
01156       do 17 ii = iup1,np1
01157         im1 = ii-1
01158         i = ii
01159         if (i .eq. np1) i=1
01160         dels = x(i)-x(im1)
01161         if (dels .le. 0.) dels=dels+p
01162         s7 = s7+(y(i)+y(im1))*dels/2.
01163         if (sigma .eq. 0.) go to 16
01164         call snhcsh (ss,cs,sigmap*dels,3)
01165         s7 = s7+(yp(i)+yp(im1))*dels*(cs-ss/2.)/
01166      *            (sigmap*sigmap*(1.+ss))
01167         go to 17
01168    16   s7 = s7-(yp(i)+yp(im1))*dels*dels*dels/24.
01169    17   continue
01170    18 s8 = 0.
01171       if (ilm1 .lt. ium1 .or. (ideltp .eq. 0 .and. bdy))
01172      *   go to 20
01173 c
01174 c integrate from xxl to xxu, store in s8
01175 c
01176       delu1 = xxu-x(ium1)
01177       delu2 = xiu-xxu
01178       dell1 = xxl-x(ium1)
01179       dell2 = xiu-xxl
01180       dels = xiu-x(ium1)
01181       deli = xxu-xxl
01182       t1 = (delu1+dell1)*deli/(2.*dels)
01183       t2 = (delu2+dell2)*deli/(2.*dels)
01184       s8 = t1*y(iu)+t2*y(ium1)
01185       if (sigma .eq. 0.) go to 19
01186       call snhcsh (dummy,cu1,sigmap*delu1,2)
01187       call snhcsh (dummy,cu2,sigmap*delu2,2)
01188       call snhcsh (dummy,cl1,sigmap*dell1,2)
01189       call snhcsh (dummy,cl2,sigmap*dell2,2)
01190       call snhcsh (ss,dummy,sigmap*dels,-1)
01191       s8 = s8+(yp(iu)*(delu1*delu1*(cu1-ss/2.)
01192      *            -dell1*dell1*(cl1-ss/2.))
01193      *          +yp(ium1)*(dell2*dell2*(cl2-ss/2.)
01194      *            -delu2*delu2*(cu2-ss/2.)))/
01195      *          (sigmap*sigmap*dels*(1.+ss))
01196       go to 20
01197    19 s8 = s8-t1*(delu2*(dels+delu1)
01198      *     +dell2*(dels+dell1))*yp(iu)/12.
01199      *     -t2*(dell1*(dels+dell2)
01200      *     +delu1*(dels+delu2))*yp(ium1)/12.
01201    20 so = s1+s2+s6+s7
01202       si = s3+s4+s5+s8
01203       if (bdy) go to 21
01204       curvpi = float(ideltp)*(so+si)+float(isign)*si
01205       return
01206    21 curvpi = float(ideltp)*(so+si)+float(isign)*so
01207       return
01208       end
01209       subroutine kurv1 (n,x,y,slp1,slpn,islpsw,xp,yp,temp,s,
01210      *                  sigma,ierr)
01211 c
01212       integer n,islpsw,ierr
01213       real x(n),y(n),slp1,slpn,xp(n),yp(n),temp(n),s(n),
01214      *     sigma
01215 c
01216 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
01217 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
01218 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
01219 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
01220 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
01221 c
01222 c this subroutine determines the parameters necessary to
01223 c compute a spline under tension forming a curve in the
01224 c plane and passing through a sequence of pairs (x(1),y(1)),
01225 c ...,(x(n),y(n)). for actual computation of points on the
01226 c curve it is necessary to call the subroutine kurv2.
01227 c
01228 c on input--
01229 c
01230 c   n is the number of points to be interpolated (n.ge.2).
01231 c
01232 c   x is an array containing the n x-coordinates of the
01233 c   points.
01234 c
01235 c   y is an array containing the n y-coordinates of the
01236 c   points. (adjacent x-y pairs must be distinct, i. e.
01237 c   either x(i) .ne. x(i+1) or y(i) .ne. y(i+1), for
01238 c   i = 1,...,n-1.)
01239 c
01240 c   slp1 and slpn contain the desired values for the angles
01241 c   (in radians) of the slope at (x(1),y(1)) and (x(n),y(n))
01242 c   respectively. the angles are measured counter-clock-
01243 c   wise from the x-axis and the positive sense of the curve
01244 c   is assumed to be that moving from point 1 to point n.
01245 c   the user may omit values for either or both of these
01246 c   parameters and signal this with islpsw.
01247 c
01248 c   islpsw contains a switch indicating which slope data
01249 c   should be used and which should be estimated by this
01250 c   subroutine,
01251 c          = 0 if slp1 and slpn are to be used,
01252 c          = 1 if slp1 is to be used but not slpn,
01253 c          = 2 if slpn is to be used but not slp1,
01254 c          = 3 if both slp1 and slpn are to be estimated
01255 c              internally.
01256 c
01257 c   xp and yp are arrays of length at least n.
01258 c
01259 c   temp is an array of length at least n which is used
01260 c   for scratch storage.
01261 c
01262 c   s is an array of length at least n.
01263 c
01264 c and
01265 c
01266 c   sigma contains the tension factor. this value indicates
01267 c   the curviness desired. if abs(sigma) is nearly zero
01268 c   (e.g. .001) the resulting curve is approximately a cubic
01269 c   spline. if abs(sigma) is large (e. g. 50.) the resulting
01270 c   curve is nearly a polygonal line. if sigma equals zero a
01271 c   cubic spline results. a standard value for sigma is
01272 c   approximately 1. in absolute value.
01273 c
01274 c on output--
01275 c
01276 c   xp and yp contain information about the curvature of the
01277 c   curve at the given nodes.
01278 c
01279 c   s contains the polygonal arclengths of the curve.
01280 c
01281 c   ierr contains an error flag,
01282 c        = 0 for normal return,
01283 c        = 1 if n is less than 2,
01284 c        = 2 if adjacent coordinate pairs coincide.
01285 c
01286 c and
01287 c
01288 c   n, x, y, slp1, slpn, islpsw, and sigma are unaltered.
01289 c
01290 c this subroutine references package modules ceez, terms,
01291 c and snhcsh.
01292 c
01293 c-----------------------------------------------------------
01294 c
01295       nm1 = n-1
01296       np1 = n+1
01297       ierr = 0
01298       if (n .le. 1) go to 11
01299 c
01300 c determine polygonal arclengths
01301 c
01302       s(1) = 0.
01303       do 1 i = 2,n
01304         im1 = i-1
01305     1   s(i) = s(im1)+sqrt((x(i)-x(im1))**2+
01306      *         (y(i)-y(im1))**2)
01307 c
01308 c denormalize tension factor
01309 c
01310       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n-1)/s(n)
01311 c
01312 c approximate end slopes
01313 c
01314       if (islpsw .ge. 2) go to 2
01315       slpp1x = cos(slp1)
01316       slpp1y = sin(slp1)
01317       go to 4
01318     2 dels1 = s(2)-s(1)
01319       dels2 = dels1+dels1
01320       if (n .gt. 2) dels2 = s(3)-s(1)
01321       if (dels1 .eq. 0. .or. dels2 .eq. 0.) go to 12
01322       call ceez (dels1,dels2,sigmap,c1,c2,c3,n)
01323       sx = c1*x(1)+c2*x(2)
01324       sy = c1*y(1)+c2*y(2)
01325       if (n .eq. 2) go to 3
01326       sx = sx+c3*x(3)
01327       sy = sy+c3*y(3)
01328     3 delt = sqrt(sx*sx+sy*sy)
01329       slpp1x = sx/delt
01330       slpp1y = sy/delt
01331     4 if (islpsw .eq. 1 .or. islpsw .eq. 3) go to 5
01332       slppnx = cos(slpn)
01333       slppny = sin(slpn)
01334       go to 7
01335     5 delsn = s(n)-s(nm1)
01336       delsnm = delsn+delsn
01337       if (n .gt. 2) delsnm = s(n)-s(n-2)
01338       if (delsn .eq. 0. .or. delsnm .eq. 0.) go to 12
01339       call ceez (-delsn,-delsnm,sigmap,c1,c2,c3,n)
01340       sx = c1*x(n)+c2*x(nm1)
01341       sy = c1*y(n)+c2*y(nm1)
01342       if (n .eq. 2) go to 6
01343       sx = sx+c3*x(n-2)
01344       sy = sy+c3*y(n-2)
01345     6 delt = sqrt(sx*sx+sy*sy)
01346       slppnx = sx/delt
01347       slppny = sy/delt
01348 c
01349 c set up right hand sides and tridiagonal system for xp and
01350 c yp and perform forward elimination
01351 c
01352     7 dx1 = (x(2)-x(1))/s(2)
01353       dy1 = (y(2)-y(1))/s(2)
01354       call terms (diag1,sdiag1,sigmap,s(2))
01355       xp(1) = (dx1-slpp1x)/diag1
01356       yp(1) = (dy1-slpp1y)/diag1
01357       temp(1) = sdiag1/diag1
01358       if (n .eq. 2) go to 9
01359       do 8 i = 2,nm1
01360         dels2 = s(i+1)-s(i)
01361         if (dels2 .eq. 0.) go to 12
01362         dx2 = (x(i+1)-x(i))/dels2
01363         dy2 = (y(i+1)-y(i))/dels2
01364         call terms (diag2,sdiag2,sigmap,dels2)
01365         diag = diag1+diag2-sdiag1*temp(i-1)
01366         diagin = 1./diag
01367         xp(i) = (dx2-dx1-sdiag1*xp(i-1))*diagin
01368         yp(i) = (dy2-dy1-sdiag1*yp(i-1))*diagin
01369         temp(i) = sdiag2*diagin
01370         dx1 = dx2
01371         dy1 = dy2
01372         diag1 = diag2
01373     8   sdiag1 = sdiag2
01374     9 diag = diag1-sdiag1*temp(nm1)
01375       xp(n) = (slppnx-dx1-sdiag1*xp(nm1))/diag
01376       yp(n) = (slppny-dy1-sdiag1*yp(nm1))/diag
01377 c
01378 c perform back substitution
01379 c
01380       do 10 i = 2,n
01381         ibak = np1-i
01382         xp(ibak) = xp(ibak)-temp(ibak)*xp(ibak+1)
01383    10   yp(ibak) = yp(ibak)-temp(ibak)*yp(ibak+1)
01384       return
01385 c
01386 c too few points
01387 c
01388    11 ierr = 1
01389       return
01390 c
01391 c coincident adjacent points
01392 c
01393    12 ierr = 2
01394       return
01395       end
01396       subroutine kurv2 (t,xs,ys,n,x,y,xp,yp,s,sigma)
01397 c
01398       integer n
01399       real t,xs,ys,x(n),y(n),xp(n),yp(n),s(n),sigma
01400 c
01401 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
01402 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
01403 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
01404 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
01405 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
01406 c
01407 c this subroutine performs the mapping of points in the
01408 c interval (0.,1.) onto a curve in the plane. the subroutine
01409 c kurv1 should be called earlier to determine certain
01410 c necessary parameters. the resulting curve has a parametric
01411 c representation both of whose components are splines under
01412 c tension and functions of the polygonal arclength
01413 c parameter.
01414 c
01415 c on input--
01416 c
01417 c   t contains a real value to be mapped to a point on the
01418 c   curve. the interval (0.,1.) is mapped onto the entire
01419 c   curve, with 0. mapping to (x(1),y(1)) and 1. mapping
01420 c   to (x(n),y(n)). values outside this interval result in
01421 c   extrapolation.
01422 c
01423 c   n contains the number of points which were specified
01424 c   to determine the curve.
01425 c
01426 c   x and y are arrays containing the x- and y-coordinates
01427 c   of the specified points.
01428 c
01429 c   xp and yp are the arrays output from kurv1 containing
01430 c   curvature information.
01431 c
01432 c   s is an array containing the polygonal arclengths of
01433 c   the curve.
01434 c
01435 c and
01436 c
01437 c   sigma contains the tension factor (its sign is ignored).
01438 c
01439 c the parameters n, x, y, xp, yp, s, and sigma should be
01440 c input unaltered from the output of kurv1.
01441 c
01442 c on output--
01443 c
01444 c   xs and ys contain the x- and y-coordinates of the image
01445 c   point on the curve.
01446 c
01447 c none of the input parameters are altered.
01448 c
01449 c this subroutine references package modules intrvl and
01450 c snhcsh.
01451 c
01452 c-----------------------------------------------------------
01453 c
01454 c determine interval
01455 c
01456       tn = s(n)*t
01457       im1 = intrvl(tn,s,n)
01458       i = im1+1
01459 c
01460 c denormalize tension factor
01461 c
01462       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n-1)/s(n)
01463 c
01464 c set up and perform interpolation
01465 c
01466       del1 = tn-s(im1)
01467       del2 = s(i)-tn
01468       dels = s(i)-s(im1)
01469       sumx = (x(i)*del1+x(im1)*del2)/dels
01470       sumy = (y(i)*del1+y(im1)*del2)/dels
01471       if (sigmap .ne. 0.) go to 1
01472       d = del1*del2/(6.*dels)
01473       c1 = (del1+dels)*d
01474       c2 = (del2+dels)*d
01475       xs = sumx-xp(i)*c1-xp(im1)*c2
01476       ys = sumy-yp(i)*c1-yp(im1)*c2
01477       return
01478     1 sigdel = sigmap*dels
01479       call snhcsh(ss,dummy,sigdel,-1)
01480       call snhcsh(s1,dummy,sigmap*del1,-1)
01481       call snhcsh(s2,dummy,sigmap*del2,-1)
01482       d = sigdel*sigmap*(1.+ss)
01483       c1 = del1*(s1-ss)/d
01484       c2 = del2*(s2-ss)/d
01485       xs = sumx+xp(i)*c1+xp(im1)*c2
01486       ys = sumy+yp(i)*c1+yp(im1)*c2
01487       return
01488       end
01489       subroutine kurvd (t,xs,ys,xst,yst,xstt,ystt,n,x,y,xp,
01490      *                  yp,s,sigma)
01491 c
01492       integer n
01493       real t,xs,ys,xst,yst,xstt,ystt,x(n),y(n),xp(n),yp(n),
01494      *     s(n),sigma
01495 c
01496 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
01497 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
01498 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
01499 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
01500 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
01501 c
01502 c this subroutine performs the mapping of points in the
01503 c interval (0.,1.) onto a curve in the plane. it also
01504 c returns the first and second derivatives of the component
01505 c functions. the subroutine kurv1 should be called earlier
01506 c to determine certain necessary parameters. the resulting
01507 c curve has a parametric representation both of whose
01508 c components are splines under tension and functions of the
01509 c polygonal arclength parameter.
01510 c
01511 c on input--
01512 c
01513 c   t contains a real value to be mapped to a point on the
01514 c   curve. the interval (0.,1.) is mapped onto the entire
01515 c   curve, with 0. mapping to (x(1),y(1)) and 1. mapping
01516 c   to (x(n),y(n)). values outside this interval result in
01517 c   extrapolation.
01518 c
01519 c   n contains the number of points which were specified
01520 c   to determine the curve.
01521 c
01522 c   x and y are arrays containing the x- and y-coordinates
01523 c   of the specified points.
01524 c
01525 c   xp and yp are the arrays output from kurv1 containing
01526 c   curvature information.
01527 c
01528 c   s is an array containing the polygonal arclengths of
01529 c   the curve.
01530 c
01531 c and
01532 c
01533 c   sigma contains the tension factor (its sign is ignored).
01534 c
01535 c the parameters n, x, y, xp, yp, s, and sigma should be
01536 c input unaltered from the output of kurv1.
01537 c
01538 c on output--
01539 c
01540 c   xs and ys contain the x- and y-coordinates of the image
01541 c   point on the curve. xst and yst contain the first
01542 c   derivatives of the x- and y-components of the mapping
01543 c   with respect to t. xstt and ystt contain the second
01544 c   derivatives of the x- and y-components of the mapping
01545 c   with respect to t.
01546 c
01547 c none of the input parameters are altered.
01548 c
01549 c this subroutine references package modules intrvl and
01550 c snhcsh.
01551 c
01552 c-----------------------------------------------------------
01553 c
01554 c determine interval
01555 c
01556       tn = s(n)*t
01557       im1 = intrvl(tn,s,n)
01558       i = im1+1
01559 c
01560 c denormalize tension factor
01561 c
01562       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n-1)/s(n)
01563 c
01564 c set up and perform interpolation
01565 c
01566       del1 = tn-s(im1)
01567       del2 = s(i)-tn
01568       dels = s(i)-s(im1)
01569       sumx = (x(i)*del1+x(im1)*del2)/dels
01570       sumy = (y(i)*del1+y(im1)*del2)/dels
01571       sumxt = s(n)*(x(i)-x(im1))/dels
01572       sumyt = s(n)*(y(i)-y(im1))/dels
01573       if (sigmap .ne. 0.) go to 1
01574       dels6 = 6.*dels
01575       d = del1*del2/dels6
01576       c1 = -(del1+dels)*d
01577       c2 = -(del2+dels)*d
01578       dels6 = dels6/s(n)
01579       ct1 = (2.*del1*del1-del2*(del1+dels))/dels6
01580       ct2 = -(2.*del2*del2-del1*(del2+dels))/dels6
01581       dels = dels/(s(n)*s(n))
01582       ctt1 = del1/dels
01583       ctt2 = del2/dels
01584       go to 2
01585     1 sigdel = sigmap*dels
01586       call snhcsh (ss,dummy,sigdel,-1)
01587       call snhcsh (s1,co1,sigmap*del1,0)
01588       call snhcsh (s2,co2,sigmap*del2,0)
01589       d = sigdel*sigmap*(1.+ss)
01590       c1 = del1*(s1-ss)/d
01591       c2 = del2*(s2-ss)/d
01592       ct1 = (co1-ss)*s(n)/d
01593       ct2 = -(co2-ss)*s(n)/d
01594       ctt1 = del1*(1.+s1)*s(n)*s(n)/(dels*(1.+ss))
01595       ctt2 = del2*(1.+s2)*s(n)*s(n)/(dels*(1.+ss))
01596     2 xs = sumx+c1*xp(i)+c2*xp(im1)
01597       ys = sumy+c1*yp(i)+c2*yp(im1)
01598       xst = sumxt+ct1*xp(i)+ct2*xp(im1)
01599       yst = sumyt+ct1*yp(i)+ct2*yp(im1)
01600       xstt = ctt1*xp(i)+ctt2*xp(im1)
01601       ystt = ctt1*yp(i)+ctt2*yp(im1)
01602       return
01603       end
01604       subroutine kurvp1 (n,x,y,xp,yp,temp,s,sigma,ierr)
01605 c
01606       integer n,ierr
01607       real x(n),y(n),xp(n),yp(n),temp(1),s(n),sigma
01608 c
01609 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
01610 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
01611 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
01612 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
01613 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
01614 c
01615 c this subroutine determines the parameters necessary to
01616 c compute a spline under tension forming a closed curve in
01617 c the plane and passing through a sequence of pairs
01618 c (x(1),y(1)),...,(x(n),y(n)). for actual computation of
01619 c points on the curve it is necessary to call the subroutine
01620 c kurvp2.
01621 c
01622 c on input--
01623 c
01624 c   n is the number of points to be interpolated (n.ge.2).
01625 c
01626 c   x is an array containing the n x-coordinates of the
01627 c   points.
01628 c
01629 c   y is an array containing the n y-coordinates of the
01630 c   points. (adjacent x-y pairs must be distinct, i. e.
01631 c   either x(i) .ne. x(i+1) or y(i) .ne. y(i+1), for
01632 c   i = 1,...,n-1 and either x(1) .ne. x(n) or y(1) .ne. y(n).)
01633 c
01634 c   xp and yp are arrays of length at least n.
01635 c
01636 c   temp is an array of length at least 2*n which is used
01637 c   for scratch storage.
01638 c
01639 c   s is an array of length at least n.
01640 c
01641 c and
01642 c
01643 c   sigma contains the tension factor. this value indicates
01644 c   the curviness desired. if abs(sigma) is nearly zero
01645 c   (e.g. .001) the resulting curve is approximately a cubic
01646 c   spline. if abs(sigma) is large (e. g. 50.) the resulting
01647 c   curve is nearly a polygonal line. if sigma equals zero a
01648 c   cubic spline results. a standard value for sigma is
01649 c   approximately 1. in absolute value.
01650 c
01651 c on output--
01652 c
01653 c   xp and yp contain information about the curvature of the
01654 c   curve at the given nodes.
01655 c
01656 c   s contains the polygonal arclengths of the curve.
01657 c
01658 c   ierr contains an error flag,
01659 c        = 0 for normal return,
01660 c        = 1 if n is less than 2,
01661 c        = 2 if adjacent coordinate pairs coincide.
01662 c
01663 c and
01664 c
01665 c   n, x, y, and sigma are unaltered,
01666 c
01667 c this subroutine references package modules terms and
01668 c snhcsh.
01669 c
01670 c-----------------------------------------------------------
01671 c
01672       nm1 = n-1
01673       np1 = n+1
01674       ierr = 0
01675       if (n .le. 1) go to 7
01676 c
01677 c determine polygonal arclengths
01678 c
01679       s(1) = sqrt((x(n)-x(1))**2+(y(n)-y(1))**2)
01680       do 1 i = 2,n
01681         im1 = i-1
01682     1   s(i) = s(im1)+sqrt((x(i)-x(im1))**2+
01683      *         (y(i)-y(im1))**2)
01684 c
01685 c denormalize tension factor
01686 c
01687       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n)/s(n)
01688 c
01689 c set up right hand sides of tridiagonal (with corner
01690 c elements) linear system for xp and yp
01691 c
01692       dels1 = s(1)
01693       if (dels1 .eq. 0.) go to 8
01694       dx1 = (x(1)-x(n))/dels1
01695       dy1 = (y(1)-y(n))/dels1
01696       call terms(diag1,sdiag1,sigmap,dels1)
01697       dels2 = s(2)-s(1)
01698       if (dels2 .eq. 0.) go to 8
01699       dx2 = (x(2)-x(1))/dels2
01700       dy2 = (y(2)-y(1))/dels2
01701       call terms(diag2,sdiag2,sigmap,dels2)
01702       diag = diag1+diag2
01703       diagin = 1./diag
01704       xp(1) = (dx2-dx1)*diagin
01705       yp(1) = (dy2-dy1)*diagin
01706       temp(np1) = -sdiag1*diagin
01707       temp(1) = sdiag2*diagin
01708       dx1 = dx2
01709       dy1 = dy2
01710       diag1 = diag2
01711       sdiag1 = sdiag2
01712       if (n .eq. 2) go to 3
01713       do 2 i = 2,nm1
01714         npi = n+i
01715         dels2 = s(i+1)-s(i)
01716         if (dels2 .eq. 0.) go to 8
01717         dx2 = (x(i+1)-x(i))/dels2
01718         dy2 = (y(i+1)-y(i))/dels2
01719         call terms(diag2,sdiag2,sigmap,dels2)
01720         diag = diag1+diag2-sdiag1*temp(i-1)
01721         diagin = 1./diag
01722         xp(i) = (dx2-dx1-sdiag1*xp(i-1))*diagin
01723         yp(i) = (dy2-dy1-sdiag1*yp(i-1))*diagin
01724         temp(npi) = -temp(npi-1)*sdiag1*diagin
01725         temp(i) = sdiag2*diagin
01726         dx1 = dx2
01727         dy1 = dy2
01728         diag1 = diag2
01729     2   sdiag1 = sdiag2
01730     3 dels2 = s(1)
01731       dx2 = (x(1)-x(n))/dels2
01732       dy2 = (y(1)-y(n))/dels2
01733       call terms(diag2,sdiag2,sigmap,dels2)
01734       xp(n) = dx2-dx1
01735       yp(n) = dy2-dy1
01736       temp(nm1) = temp(2*n-1)-temp(nm1)
01737       if (n.eq.2) go to 5
01738 c
01739 c perform first step of back substitution
01740 c
01741       do 4 i = 3,n
01742         ibak = np1-i
01743         npibak = n+ibak
01744         xp(ibak) = xp(ibak)-temp(ibak)*xp(ibak+1)
01745         yp(ibak) = yp(ibak)-temp(ibak)*yp(ibak+1)
01746     4   temp(ibak) = temp(npibak)-temp(ibak)*temp(ibak+1)
01747     5 xp(n) = (xp(n)-sdiag2*xp(1)-sdiag1*xp(nm1))/
01748      *        (diag1+diag2+sdiag2*temp(1)+sdiag1*temp(nm1))
01749       yp(n) = (yp(n)-sdiag2*yp(1)-sdiag1*yp(nm1))/
01750      *        (diag1+diag2+sdiag2*temp(1)+sdiag1*temp(nm1))
01751 c
01752 c perform second step of back substitution
01753 c
01754       xpn = xp(n)
01755       ypn = yp(n)
01756       do 6 i = 1,nm1
01757         xp(i) = xp(i)+temp(i)*xpn
01758     6   yp(i) = yp(i)+temp(i)*ypn
01759       return
01760 c
01761 c too few points
01762 c
01763     7 ierr = 1
01764       return
01765 c
01766 c coincident adjacent points
01767 c
01768     8 ierr = 2
01769       return
01770       end
01771       subroutine kurvp2 (t,xs,ys,n,x,y,xp,yp,s,sigma)
01772 c
01773       integer n
01774       real t,xs,ys,x(n),y(n),xp(n),yp(n),s(n),sigma
01775 c
01776 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
01777 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
01778 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
01779 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
01780 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
01781 c
01782 c this subroutine performs the mapping of points in the
01783 c interval (0.,1.) onto a closed curve in the plane. the
01784 c subroutine kurvp1 should be called earlier to determine
01785 c certain necessary parameters. the resulting curve has a
01786 c parametric representation both of whose components are
01787 c periodic splines under tension and functions of the poly-
01788 c gonal arclength parameter.
01789 c
01790 c on input--
01791 c
01792 c   t contains a value to be mapped onto the curve. the
01793 c   interval (0.,1.) is mapped onto the entire closed curve
01794 c   with both 0. and 1. mapping to (x(1),y(1)). the mapping
01795 c   is periodic with period one thus any interval of the
01796 c   form (tt,tt+1.) maps onto the entire curve.
01797 c
01798 c   n contains the number of points which were specified
01799 c   to determine the curve.
01800 c
01801 c   x and y are arrays containing the x- and y-coordinates
01802 c   of the specified points.
01803 c
01804 c   xp and yp are the arrays output from kurvp1 containing
01805 c   curvature information.
01806 c
01807 c   s is an array containing the polygonal arclengths of
01808 c   the curve.
01809 c
01810 c and
01811 c
01812 c   sigma contains the tension factor (its sign is ignored).
01813 c
01814 c the parameters n, x, y, xp, yp, s and sigma should
01815 c be input unaltered from the output of kurvp1.
01816 c
01817 c on output--
01818 c
01819 c   xs and ys contain the x- and y-coordinates of the image
01820 c   point on the curve.
01821 c
01822 c none of the input parameters are altered.
01823 c
01824 c this subroutine references package modules intrvl and
01825 c snhcsh.
01826 c
01827 c-----------------------------------------------------------
01828 c
01829 c determine interval
01830 c
01831       tn = t-float(ifix(t))
01832       if (tn .lt. 0.) tn = tn+1.
01833       tn = s(n)*tn+s(1)
01834       im1 = n
01835       if (tn .lt. s(n)) im1 = intrvl(tn,s,n)
01836       i = im1+1
01837       if (i .gt. n) i = 1
01838 c
01839 c denormalize tension factor
01840 c
01841       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n)/s(n)
01842 c
01843 c set up and perform interpolation
01844 c
01845       si = s(i)
01846       if (im1 .eq. n) si = s(n)+s(1)
01847       del1 = tn-s(im1)
01848       del2 = si-tn
01849       dels = si-s(im1)
01850       sumx = (x(i)*del1+x(im1)*del2)/dels
01851       sumy = (y(i)*del1+y(im1)*del2)/dels
01852       if (sigmap .ne. 0.) go to 1
01853       d = del1*del2/(6.*dels)
01854       c1 = (del1+dels)*d
01855       c2 = (del2+dels)*d
01856       xs = sumx-xp(i)*c1-xp(im1)*c2
01857       ys = sumy-yp(i)*c1-yp(im1)*c2
01858       return
01859     1 sigdel = sigmap*dels
01860       call snhcsh(ss,dummy,sigdel,-1)
01861       call snhcsh(s1,dummy,sigmap*del1,-1)
01862       call snhcsh(s2,dummy,sigmap*del2,-1)
01863       d = sigdel*sigmap*(1.+ss)
01864       ci = del1*(s1-ss)/d
01865       cim1 = del2*(s2-ss)/d
01866       xs = sumx+xp(i)*ci+xp(im1)*cim1
01867       ys = sumy+yp(i)*ci+yp(im1)*cim1
01868       return
01869       end
01870       subroutine kurvpd (t,xs,ys,xst,yst,xstt,ystt,n,x,y,xp,
01871      *                  yp,s,sigma)
01872 c
01873       integer n
01874       real t,xs,ys,xst,yst,xstt,ystt,x(n),y(n),xp(n),yp(n),
01875      *     s(n),sigma
01876 c
01877 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
01878 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
01879 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
01880 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
01881 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
01882 c
01883 c this subroutine performs the mapping of points in the
01884 c interval (0.,1.) onto a closed curve in the plane. it also
01885 c returns the first and second derivatives of the component
01886 c functions. the subroutine kurvp1 should be called earlier
01887 c to determine certain necessary parameters. the resulting
01888 c curve has a parametric representation both of whose
01889 c components are periodic splines under tension and
01890 c functions of the polygonal arclength parameter.
01891 c
01892 c on input--
01893 c
01894 c   t contains a value to be mapped onto the curve. the
01895 c   interval (0.,1.) is mapped onto the entire closed curve
01896 c   with both 0. and 1. mapping to (x(1),y(1)). the mapping
01897 c   is periodic with period one thus any interval of the
01898 c   form (tt,tt+1.) maps onto the entire curve.
01899 c
01900 c   n contains the number of points which were specified
01901 c   to determine the curve.
01902 c
01903 c   x and y are arrays containing the x- and y-coordinates
01904 c   of the specified points.
01905 c
01906 c   xp and yp are the arrays output from kurvp1 containing
01907 c   curvature information.
01908 c
01909 c   s is an array containing the polygonal arclengths of
01910 c   the curve.
01911 c
01912 c and
01913 c
01914 c   sigma contains the tension factor (its sign is ignored).
01915 c
01916 c the parameters n, x, y, xp, yp, s and sigma should
01917 c be input unaltered from the output of kurvp1.
01918 c
01919 c on output--
01920 c
01921 c   xs and ys contain the x- and y-coordinates of the image
01922 c   point on the curve. xst and yst contain the first
01923 c   derivatives of the x- and y-components of the mapping
01924 c   with respect to t. xstt and ystt contain the second
01925 c   derivatives of the x- and y-components of the mapping
01926 c   with respect to t.
01927 c
01928 c none of the input parameters are altered.
01929 c
01930 c this subroutine references package modules intrvl and
01931 c snhcsh.
01932 c
01933 c-----------------------------------------------------------
01934 c
01935 c determine interval
01936 c
01937       tn = t-float(ifix(t))
01938       if (tn .lt. 0.) tn = tn+1.
01939       tn = s(n)*tn+s(1)
01940       im1 = n
01941       if (tn .lt. s(n)) im1 = intrvl(tn,s,n)
01942       i = im1+1
01943       if (i .gt. n) i = 1
01944 c
01945 c denormalize tension factor
01946 c
01947       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n)/s(n)
01948 c
01949 c set up and perform interpolation
01950 c
01951       si = s(i)
01952       if (im1 .eq. n) si = s(n)+s(1)
01953       del1 = tn-s(im1)
01954       del2 = si-tn
01955       dels = si-s(im1)
01956       sumx = (x(i)*del1+x(im1)*del2)/dels
01957       sumy = (y(i)*del1+y(im1)*del2)/dels
01958       sumxt = s(n)*(x(i)-x(im1))/dels
01959       sumyt = s(n)*(y(i)-y(im1))/dels
01960       if (sigmap .ne. 0.) go to 1
01961       dels6 = 6.*dels
01962       d = del1*del2/dels6
01963       c1 = -(del1+dels)*d
01964       c2 = -(del2+dels)*d
01965       dels6 = dels6/s(n)
01966       ct1 = (2.*del1*del1-del2*(del1+dels))/dels6
01967       ct2 = -(2.*del2*del2-del1*(del2+dels))/dels6
01968       dels = dels/(s(n)*s(n))
01969       ctt1 = del1/dels
01970       ctt2 = del2/dels
01971       go to 2
01972     1 sigdel = sigmap*dels
01973       call snhcsh (ss,dummy,sigdel,-1)
01974       call snhcsh (s1,co1,sigmap*del1,0)
01975       call snhcsh (s2,co2,sigmap*del2,0)
01976       d = sigdel*sigmap*(1.+ss)
01977       c1 = del1*(s1-ss)/d
01978       c2 = del2*(s2-ss)/d
01979       ct1 = (co1-ss)*s(n)/d
01980       ct2 = -(co2-ss)*s(n)/d
01981       ctt1 = del1*(1.+s1)*s(n)*s(n)/(dels*(1.+ss))
01982       ctt2 = del2*(1.+s2)*s(n)*s(n)/(dels*(1.+ss))
01983     2 xs = sumx+c1*xp(i)+c2*xp(im1)
01984       ys = sumy+c1*yp(i)+c2*yp(im1)
01985       xst = sumxt+ct1*xp(i)+ct2*xp(im1)
01986       yst = sumyt+ct1*yp(i)+ct2*yp(im1)
01987       xstt = ctt1*xp(i)+ctt2*xp(im1)
01988       ystt = ctt1*yp(i)+ctt2*yp(im1)
01989       return
01990       end
01991       subroutine surf1 (m,n,x,y,z,iz,zx1,zxm,zy1,zyn,zxy11,
01992      *                  zxym1,zxy1n,zxymn,islpsw,zp,temp,
01993      *                  sigma,ierr)
01994 c
01995       integer m,n,iz,islpsw,ierr
01996       real x(m),y(n),z(iz,n),zx1(n),zxm(n),zy1(m),zyn(m),
01997      *     zxy11,zxym1,zxy1n,zxymn,zp(m,n,3),temp(1),sigma
01998 c
01999 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
02000 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
02001 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
02002 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
02003 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
02004 c
02005 c this subroutine determines the parameters necessary to
02006 c compute an interpolatory surface passing through a rect-
02007 c angular grid of functional values. the surface determined
02008 c can be represented as the tensor product of splines under
02009 c tension. the x- and y-partial derivatives around the
02010 c boundary and the x-y-partial derivatives at the four
02011 c corners may be specified or omitted. for actual mapping
02012 c of points onto the surface it is necessary to call the
02013 c function surf2.
02014 c
02015 c on input--
02016 c
02017 c   m is the number of grid lines in the x-direction, i. e.
02018 c   lines parallel to the y-axis (m .ge. 2).
02019 c
02020 c   n is the number of grid lines in the y-direction, i. e.
02021 c   lines parallel to the x-axis (n .ge. 2).
02022 c
02023 c   x is an array of the m x-coordinates of the grid lines
02024 c   in the x-direction. these should be strictly increasing.
02025 c
02026 c   y is an array of the n y-coordinates of the grid lines
02027 c   in the y-direction. these should be strictly increasing.
02028 c
02029 c   z is an array of the m * n functional values at the grid
02030 c   points, i. e. z(i,j) contains the functional value at
02031 c   (x(i),y(j)) for i = 1,...,m and j = 1,...,n.
02032 c
02033 c   iz is the row dimension of the matrix z used in the
02034 c   calling program (iz .ge. m).
02035 c
02036 c   zx1 and zxm are arrays of the m x-partial derivatives
02037 c   of the function along the x(1) and x(m) grid lines,
02038 c   respectively. thus zx1(j) and zxm(j) contain the x-part-
02039 c   ial derivatives at the points (x(1),y(j)) and
02040 c   (x(m),y(j)), respectively, for j = 1,...,n. either of
02041 c   these parameters will be ignored (and approximations
02042 c   supplied internally) if islpsw so indicates.
02043 c
02044 c   zy1 and zyn are arrays of the n y-partial derivatives
02045 c   of the function along the y(1) and y(n) grid lines,
02046 c   respectively. thus zy1(i) and zyn(i) contain the y-part-
02047 c   ial derivatives at the points (x(i),y(1)) and
02048 c   (x(i),y(n)), respectively, for i = 1,...,m. either of
02049 c   these parameters will be ignored (and estimations
02050 c   supplied internally) if islpsw so indicates.
02051 c
02052 c   zxy11, zxym1, zxy1n, and zxymn are the x-y-partial
02053 c   derivatives of the function at the four corners,
02054 c   (x(1),y(1)), (x(m),y(1)), (x(1),y(n)), and (x(m),y(n)),
02055 c   respectively. any of the parameters will be ignored (and
02056 c   estimations supplied internally) if islpsw so indicates.
02057 c
02058 c   islpsw contains a switch indicating which boundary
02059 c   derivative information is user-supplied and which
02060 c   should be estimated by this subroutine. to determine
02061 c   islpsw, let
02062 c        i1 = 0 if zx1 is user-supplied (and = 1 otherwise),
02063 c        i2 = 0 if zxm is user-supplied (and = 1 otherwise),
02064 c        i3 = 0 if zy1 is user-supplied (and = 1 otherwise),
02065 c        i4 = 0 if zyn is user-supplied (and = 1 otherwise),
02066 c        i5 = 0 if zxy11 is user-supplied
02067 c                                       (and = 1 otherwise),
02068 c        i6 = 0 if zxym1 is user-supplied
02069 c                                       (and = 1 otherwise),
02070 c        i7 = 0 if zxy1n is user-supplied
02071 c                                       (and = 1 otherwise),
02072 c        i8 = 0 if zxymn is user-supplied
02073 c                                       (and = 1 otherwise),
02074 c   then islpsw = i1 + 2*i2 + 4*i3 + 8*i4 + 16*i5 + 32*i6
02075 c                   + 64*i7 + 128*i8
02076 c   thus islpsw = 0 indicates all derivative information is
02077 c   user-supplied and islpsw = 255 indicates no derivative
02078 c   information is user-supplied. any value between these
02079 c   limits is valid.
02080 c
02081 c   zp is an array of at least 3*m*n locations.
02082 c
02083 c   temp is an array of at least n+n+m locations which is
02084 c   used for scratch storage.
02085 c
02086 c and
02087 c
02088 c   sigma contains the tension factor. this value indicates
02089 c   the curviness desired. if abs(sigma) is nearly zero
02090 c   (e. g. .001) the resulting surface is approximately the
02091 c   tensor product of cubic splines. if abs(sigma) is large
02092 c   (e. g. 50.) the resulting surface is approximately
02093 c   bi-linear. if sigma equals zero tensor products of
02094 c   cubic splines result. a standard value for sigma is
02095 c   approximately 1. in absolute value.
02096 c
02097 c on output--
02098 c
02099 c   zp contains the values of the xx-, yy-, and xxyy-partial
02100 c   derivatives of the surface at the given nodes.
02101 c
02102 c   ierr contains an error flag,
02103 c        = 0 for normal return,
02104 c        = 1 if n is less than 2 or m is less than 2,
02105 c        = 2 if the x-values or y-values are not strictly
02106 c            increasing.
02107 c
02108 c and
02109 c
02110 c   m, n, x, y, z, iz, zx1, zxm, zy1, zyn, zxy11, zxym1,
02111 c   zxy1n, zxymn, islpsw, and sigma are unaltered.
02112 c
02113 c this subroutine references package modules ceez, terms,
02114 c and snhcsh.
02115 c
02116 c-----------------------------------------------------------
02117 c
02118       mm1 = m-1
02119       mp1 = m+1
02120       nm1 = n-1
02121       np1 = n+1
02122       npm = n+m
02123       ierr = 0
02124       if (n .le. 1 .or. m .le. 1) go to 46
02125       if (y(n) .le. y(1)) go to 47
02126 c
02127 c denormalize tension factor in y-direction
02128 c
02129       sigmay = abs(sigma)*float(n-1)/(y(n)-y(1))
02130 c
02131 c obtain y-partial derivatives along y = y(1)
02132 c
02133       if ((islpsw/8)*2 .ne. (islpsw/4)) go to 2
02134       do 1 i = 1,m
02135     1   zp(i,1,1) = zy1(i)
02136       go to 5
02137     2 dely1 = y(2)-y(1)
02138       dely2 = dely1+dely1
02139       if (n .gt. 2) dely2 = y(3)-y(1)
02140       if (dely1 .le. 0. .or. dely2 .le. dely1) go to 47
02141       call ceez (dely1,dely2,sigmay,c1,c2,c3,n)
02142       do 3 i = 1,m
02143     3   zp(i,1,1) = c1*z(i,1)+c2*z(i,2)
02144       if (n .eq. 2) go to 5
02145       do 4 i = 1,m
02146     4   zp(i,1,1) = zp(i,1,1)+c3*z(i,3)
02147 c
02148 c obtain y-partial derivatives along y = y(n)
02149 c
02150     5 if ((islpsw/16)*2 .ne. (islpsw/8)) go to 7
02151       do 6 i = 1,m
02152         npi = n+i
02153     6   temp(npi) = zyn(i)
02154       go to 10
02155     7 delyn = y(n)-y(nm1)
