02156       delynm = delyn+delyn
02157       if (n .gt. 2) delynm = y(n)-y(n-2)
02158       if (delyn .le. 0. .or. delynm .le. delyn) go to 47
02159       call ceez (-delyn,-delynm,sigmay,c1,c2,c3,n)
02160       do 8 i = 1,m
02161         npi = n+i
02162     8   temp(npi) = c1*z(i,n)+c2*z(i,nm1)
02163       if (n .eq. 2) go to 10
02164       do 9 i = 1,m
02165         npi = n+i
02166     9   temp(npi) = temp(npi)+c3*z(i,n-2)
02167    10 if (x(m) .le. x(1)) go to 47
02168 c
02169 c denormalize tension factor in x-direction
02170 c
02171       sigmax = abs(sigma)*float(m-1)/(x(m)-x(1))
02172 c
02173 c obtain x-partial derivatives along x = x(1)
02174 c
02175       if ((islpsw/2)*2 .ne. islpsw) go to 12
02176       do 11 j = 1,n
02177    11   zp(1,j,2) = zx1(j)
02178       if ((islpsw/32)*2 .eq. (islpsw/16) .and.
02179      *    (islpsw/128)*2  .eq. (islpsw/64)) go to 15
02180    12 delx1 = x(2)-x(1)
02181       delx2 = delx1+delx1
02182       if (m .gt. 2) delx2 = x(3)-x(1)
02183       if (delx1 .le. 0. .or. delx2 .le. delx1) go to 47
02184       call ceez (delx1,delx2,sigmax,c1,c2,c3,m)
02185       if ((islpsw/2)*2 .eq. islpsw) go to 15
02186       do 13 j = 1,n
02187    13   zp(1,j,2) = c1*z(1,j)+c2*z(2,j)
02188       if (m .eq. 2) go to 15
02189       do 14 j = 1,n
02190    14   zp(1,j,2) = zp(1,j,2)+c3*z(3,j)
02191 c
02192 c obtain x-y-partial derivative at (x(1),y(1))
02193 c
02194    15 if ((islpsw/32)*2 .ne. (islpsw/16)) go to 16
02195       zp(1,1,3) = zxy11
02196       go to 17
02197    16 zp(1,1,3) = c1*zp(1,1,1)+c2*zp(2,1,1)
02198       if (m .gt. 2) zp(1,1,3) = zp(1,1,3)+c3*zp(3,1,1)
02199 c
02200 c obtain x-y-partial derivative at (x(1),y(n))
02201 c
02202    17 if ((islpsw/128)*2 .ne. (islpsw/64)) go to 18
02203       zxy1ns = zxy1n
02204       go to 19
02205    18 zxy1ns = c1*temp(n+1)+c2*temp(n+2)
02206       if (m .gt. 2) zxy1ns = zxy1ns+c3*temp(n+3)
02207 c
02208 c obtain x-partial derivative along x = x(m)
02209 c
02210    19 if ((islpsw/4)*2 .ne. (islpsw/2)) go to 21
02211       do 20 j = 1,n
02212         npmpj = npm+j
02213    20   temp(npmpj) = zxm(j)
02214       if ((islpsw/64)*2 .eq. (islpsw/32) .and.
02215      *    (islpsw/256)*2 .eq. (islpsw/128)) go to 24
02216    21 delxm = x(m)-x(mm1)
02217       delxmm = delxm+delxm
02218       if (m .gt. 2) delxmm = x(m)-x(m-2)
02219       if (delxm .le. 0. .or. delxmm .le. delxm) go to 47
02220       call ceez (-delxm,-delxmm,sigmax,c1,c2,c3,m)
02221       if ((islpsw/4)*2 .eq. (islpsw/2)) go to 24
02222       do 22 j = 1,n
02223         npmpj = npm+j
02224    22   temp(npmpj) = c1*z(m,j)+c2*z(mm1,j)
02225       if (m .eq. 2) go to 24
02226       do 23 j = 1,n
02227         npmpj = npm+j
02228    23   temp(npmpj) = temp(npmpj)+c3*z(m-2,j)
02229 c
02230 c obtain x-y-partial derivative at (x(m),y(1))
02231 c
02232    24 if ((islpsw/64)*2 .ne. (islpsw/32)) go to 25
02233       zp(m,1,3) = zxym1
02234       go to 26
02235    25 zp(m,1,3) = c1*zp(m,1,1)+c2*zp(mm1,1,1)
02236       if (m .gt. 2) zp(m,1,3) = zp(m,1,3)+c3*zp(m-2,1,1)
02237 c
02238 c obtain x-y-partial derivative at (x(m),y(n))
02239 c
02240    26 if ((islpsw/256)*2 .ne. (islpsw/128)) go to 27
02241       zxymns = zxymn
02242       go to 28
02243    27 zxymns = c1*temp(npm)+c2*temp(npm-1)
02244       if (m .gt. 2) zxymns = zxymns+c3*temp(npm-2)
02245 c
02246 c set up right hand sides and tridiagonal system for y-grid
02247 c perform forward elimination
02248 c
02249    28 del1 = y(2)-y(1)
02250       if (del1 .le. 0.) go to 47
02251       deli = 1./del1
02252       do 29 i = 1,m
02253    29   zp(i,2,1) = deli*(z(i,2)-z(i,1))
02254       zp(1,2,3) = deli*(zp(1,2,2)-zp(1,1,2))
02255       zp(m,2,3) = deli*(temp(npm+2)-temp(npm+1))
02256       call terms (diag1,sdiag1,sigmay,del1)
02257       diagi = 1./diag1
02258       do 30 i = 1,m
02259    30   zp(i,1,1) = diagi*(zp(i,2,1)-zp(i,1,1))
02260       zp(1,1,3) = diagi*(zp(1,2,3)-zp(1,1,3))
02261       zp(m,1,3) = diagi*(zp(m,2,3)-zp(m,1,3))
02262       temp(1) = diagi*sdiag1
02263       if (n .eq. 2) go to 34
02264       do 33 j = 2,nm1
02265         jm1 = j-1
02266         jp1 = j+1
02267         npmpj = npm+j
02268         del2 = y(jp1)-y(j)
02269         if (del2 .le. 0.) go to 47
02270         deli = 1./del2
02271         do 31 i = 1,m
02272    31     zp(i,jp1,1) = deli*(z(i,jp1)-z(i,j))
02273         zp(1,jp1,3) = deli*(zp(1,jp1,2)-zp(1,j,2))
02274         zp(m,jp1,3) = deli*(temp(npmpj+1)-temp(npmpj))
02275         call terms (diag2,sdiag2,sigmay,del2)
02276         diagin = 1./(diag1+diag2-sdiag1*temp(jm1))
02277         do 32 i = 1,m
02278    32     zp(i,j,1) = diagin*(zp(i,jp1,1)-zp(i,j,1)-
02279      *                        sdiag1*zp(i,jm1,1))
02280         zp(1,j,3) = diagin*(zp(1,jp1,3)-zp(1,j,3)-
02281      *                      sdiag1*zp(1,jm1,3))
02282         zp(m,j,3) = diagin*(zp(m,jp1,3)-zp(m,j,3)-
02283      *                      sdiag1*zp(m,jm1,3))
02284         temp(j) = diagin*sdiag2
02285         diag1 = diag2
02286    33   sdiag1 = sdiag2
02287    34 diagin = 1./(diag1-sdiag1*temp(nm1))
02288       do 35 i = 1,m
02289         npi = n+i
02290    35   zp(i,n,1) = diagin*(temp(npi)-zp(i,n,1)-
02291      *                      sdiag1*zp(i,nm1,1))
02292       zp(1,n,3) = diagin*(zxy1ns-zp(1,n,3)-
02293      *                    sdiag1*zp(1,nm1,3))
02294       temp(n) = diagin*(zxymns-zp(m,n,3)-
02295      *                  sdiag1*zp(m,nm1,3))
02296 c
02297 c perform back substitution
02298 c
02299       do 37 j = 2,n
02300         jbak = np1-j
02301         jbakp1 = jbak+1
02302         t = temp(jbak)
02303         do 36 i = 1,m
02304    36     zp(i,jbak,1) = zp(i,jbak,1)-t*zp(i,jbakp1,1)
02305         zp(1,jbak,3) = zp(1,jbak,3)-t*zp(1,jbakp1,3)
02306    37   temp(jbak) = zp(m,jbak,3)-t*temp(jbakp1)
02307 c
02308 c set up right hand sides and tridiagonal system for x-grid
02309 c perform forward elimination
02310 c
02311       del1 = x(2)-x(1)
02312       if (del1 .le. 0.) go to 47
02313       deli = 1./del1
02314       do 38 j = 1,n
02315         zp(2,j,2) = deli*(z(2,j)-z(1,j))
02316    38   zp(2,j,3) = deli*(zp(2,j,1)-zp(1,j,1))
02317       call terms (diag1,sdiag1,sigmax,del1)
02318       diagi = 1./diag1
02319       do 39 j = 1,n
02320         zp(1,j,2) = diagi*(zp(2,j,2)-zp(1,j,2))
02321    39   zp(1,j,3) = diagi*(zp(2,j,3)-zp(1,j,3))
02322       temp(n+1) = diagi*sdiag1
02323       if (m  .eq. 2) go to 43
02324       do 42 i = 2,mm1
02325         im1 = i-1
02326         ip1 = i+1
02327         npi = n+i
02328         del2 = x(ip1)-x(i)
02329         if (del2 .le. 0.) go to 47
02330         deli = 1./del2
02331         do 40 j = 1,n
02332           zp(ip1,j,2) = deli*(z(ip1,j)-z(i,j))
02333    40     zp(ip1,j,3) = deli*(zp(ip1,j,1)-zp(i,j,1))
02334         call terms (diag2,sdiag2,sigmax,del2)
02335         diagin = 1./(diag1+diag2-sdiag1*temp(npi-1))
02336         do 41 j = 1,n
02337           zp(i,j,2) = diagin*(zp(ip1,j,2)-zp(i,j,2)-
02338      *                        sdiag1*zp(im1,j,2))
02339    41     zp(i,j,3) = diagin*(zp(ip1,j,3)-zp(i,j,3)-
02340      *                        sdiag1*zp(im1,j,3))
02341         temp(npi) = diagin*sdiag2
02342         diag1 = diag2
02343    42   sdiag1 = sdiag2
02344    43 diagin = 1./(diag1-sdiag1*temp(npm-1))
02345       do 44 j = 1,n
02346         npmpj = npm+j
02347         zp(m,j,2) = diagin*(temp(npmpj)-zp(m,j,2)-
02348      *                      sdiag1*zp(mm1,j,2))
02349    44   zp(m,j,3) = diagin*(temp(j)-zp(m,j,3)-
02350      *                      sdiag1*zp(mm1,j,3))
02351 c
02352 c perform back substitution
02353 c
02354       do 45 i = 2,m
02355         ibak = mp1-i
02356         ibakp1 = ibak+1
02357         npibak = n+ibak
02358         t = temp(npibak)
02359         do 45 j = 1,n
02360           zp(ibak,j,2) = zp(ibak,j,2)-t*zp(ibakp1,j,2)
02361    45     zp(ibak,j,3) = zp(ibak,j,3)-t*zp(ibakp1,j,3)
02362       return
02363 c
02364 c too few points
02365 c
02366    46 ierr = 1
02367       return
02368 c
02369 c points not strictly increasing
02370 c
02371    47 ierr = 2
02372       return
02373       end
02374       function surf2 (xx,yy,m,n,x,y,z,iz,zp,sigma)
02375 c
02376       integer m,n,iz
02377       real xx,yy,x(m),y(n),z(iz,n),zp(m,n,3),sigma
02378 c
02379 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
02380 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
02381 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
02382 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
02383 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
02384 c
02385 c this function interpolates a surface at a given coordinate
02386 c pair using a bi-spline under tension. the subroutine surf1
02387 c should be called earlier to determine certain necessary
02388 c parameters.
02389 c
02390 c on input--
02391 c
02392 c   xx and yy contain the x- and y-coordinates of the point
02393 c   to be mapped onto the interpolating surface.
02394 c
02395 c   m and n contain the number of grid lines in the x- and
02396 c   y-directions, respectively, of the rectangular grid
02397 c   which specified the surface.
02398 c
02399 c   x and y are arrays containing the x- and y-grid values,
02400 c   respectively, each in increasing order.
02401 c
02402 c   z is a matrix containing the m * n functional values
02403 c   corresponding to the grid values (i. e. z(i,j) is the
02404 c   surface value at the point (x(i),y(j)) for i = 1,...,m
02405 c   and j = 1,...,n).
02406 c
02407 c   iz contains the row dimension of the array z as declared
02408 c   in the calling program.
02409 c
02410 c   zp is an array of 3*m*n locations stored with the
02411 c   various surface derivative information determined by
02412 c   surf1.
02413 c
02414 c and
02415 c
02416 c   sigma contains the tension factor (its sign is ignored).
02417 c
02418 c the parameters m, n, x, y, z, iz, zp, and sigma should be
02419 c input unaltered from the output of surf1.
02420 c
02421 c on output--
02422 c
02423 c   surf2 contains the interpolated surface value.
02424 c
02425 c none of the input parameters are altered.
02426 c
02427 c this function references package modules intrvl and
02428 c snhcsh.
02429 c
02430 c-----------------------------------------------------------
02431 c
02432 c inline one dimensional cubic spline interpolation
02433 c
02434       hermz (f1,f2,fp1,fp2) = (f2*del1+f1*del2)/dels-del1*
02435      *                        del2*(fp2*(del1+dels)+
02436      *                              fp1*(del2+dels))/
02437      *                        (6.*dels)
02438 c
02439 c inline one dimensional spline under tension interpolation
02440 c
02441       hermnz (f1,f2,fp1,fp2,sigmap) = (f2*del1+f1*del2)/dels
02442      *          +(fp2*del1*(sinhm1-sinhms)
02443      *           +fp1*del2*(sinhm2-sinhms)
02444      *          )/(sigmap*sigmap*dels*(1.+sinhms))
02445 c
02446 c denormalize tension factor in x and y direction
02447 c
02448       sigmax = abs(sigma)*float(m-1)/(x(m)-x(1))
02449       sigmay = abs(sigma)*float(n-1)/(y(n)-y(1))
02450 c
02451 c determine y interval
02452 c
02453       jm1 = intrvl (yy,y,n)
02454       j = jm1+1
02455 c
02456 c determine x interval
02457 c
02458       im1 = intrvl (xx,x,m)
02459       i = im1+1
02460       del1 = yy-y(jm1)
02461       del2 = y(j)-yy
02462       dels = y(j)-y(jm1)
02463       if (sigmay .ne. 0.) go to 1
02464 c
02465 c perform four interpolations in y-direction
02466 c
02467       zim1 = hermz(z(i-1,j-1),z(i-1,j),zp(i-1,j-1,1),
02468      *                                  zp(i-1,j,1))
02469       zi = hermz(z(i,j-1),z(i,j),zp(i,j-1,1),zp(i,j,1))
02470       zxxim1 = hermz(zp(i-1,j-1,2),zp(i-1,j,2),
02471      *                zp(i-1,j-1,3),zp(i-1,j,3))
02472       zxxi = hermz(zp(i,j-1,2),zp(i,j,2),
02473      *              zp(i,j-1,3),zp(i,j,3))
02474       go to 2
02475     1 call snhcsh (sinhm1,dummy,sigmay*del1,-1)
02476       call snhcsh (sinhm2,dummy,sigmay*del2,-1)
02477       call snhcsh (sinhms,dummy,sigmay*dels,-1)
02478       zim1 = hermnz(z(i-1,j-1),z(i-1,j),zp(i-1,j-1,1),
02479      *               zp(i-1,j,1),sigmay)
02480       zi = hermnz(z(i,j-1),z(i,j),zp(i,j-1,1),zp(i,j,1),
02481      *             sigmay)
02482       zxxim1 = hermnz(zp(i-1,j-1,2),zp(i-1,j,2),
02483      *                 zp(i-1,j-1,3),zp(i-1,j,3),sigmay)
02484       zxxi = hermnz(zp(i,j-1,2),zp(i,j,2),
02485      *               zp(i,j-1,3),zp(i,j,3),sigmay)
02486 c
02487 c perform final interpolation in x-direction
02488 c
02489     2 del1 = xx-x(im1)
02490       del2 = x(i)-xx
02491       dels = x(i)-x(im1)
02492       if (sigmax .ne. 0.) go to 3
02493       surf2 = hermz(zim1,zi,zxxim1,zxxi)
02494       return
02495     3 call snhcsh (sinhm1,dummy,sigmax*del1,-1)
02496       call snhcsh (sinhm2,dummy,sigmax*del2,-1)
02497       call snhcsh (sinhms,dummy,sigmax*dels,-1)
02498       surf2 = hermnz(zim1,zi,zxxim1,zxxi,sigmax)
02499       return
02500       end
02501       subroutine ceez (del1,del2,sigma,c1,c2,c3,n)
02502 c
02503       real del1,del2,sigma,c1,c2,c3
02504 c
02505 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
02506 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
02507 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
02508 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
02509 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
02510 c
02511 c this subroutine determines the coefficients c1, c2, and c3
02512 c used to determine endpoint slopes. specifically, if
02513 c function values y1, y2, and y3 are given at points x1, x2,
02514 c and x3, respectively, the quantity c1*y1 + c2*y2 + c3*y3
02515 c is the value of the derivative at x1 of a spline under
02516 c tension (with tension factor sigma) passing through the
02517 c three points and having third derivative equal to zero at
02518 c x1. optionally, only two values, c1 and c2 are determined.
02519 c
02520 c on input--
02521 c
02522 c   del1 is x2-x1 (.gt. 0.).
02523 c
02524 c   del2 is x3-x1 (.gt. 0.). if n .eq. 2, this parameter is
02525 c   ignored.
02526 c
02527 c   sigma is the tension factor.
02528 c
02529 c and
02530 c
02531 c   n is a switch indicating the number of coefficients to
02532 c   be returned. if n .eq. 2 only two coefficients are
02533 c   returned. otherwise all three are returned.
02534 c
02535 c on output--
02536 c
02537 c   c1, c2, and c3 contain the coefficients.
02538 c
02539 c none of the input parameters are altered.
02540 c
02541 c this subroutine references package module snhcsh.
02542 c
02543 c-----------------------------------------------------------
02544 c
02545       if (n .eq. 2) go to 2
02546       if (sigma .ne. 0.) go to 1
02547       del = del2-del1
02548 c
02549 c tension .eq. 0.
02550 c
02551       c1 = -(del1+del2)/(del1*del2)
02552       c2 = del2/(del1*del)
02553       c3 = -del1/(del2*del)
02554       return
02555 c
02556 c tension .ne. 0.
02557 c
02558     1 call snhcsh (dummy,coshm1,sigma*del1,1)
02559       call snhcsh (dummy,coshm2,sigma*del2,1)
02560       delp = sigma*(del2+del1)/2.
02561       delm = sigma*(del2-del1)/2.
02562       call snhcsh (sinhmp,dummy,delp,-1)
02563       call snhcsh (sinhmm,dummy,delm,-1)
02564       denom = coshm1*(del2-del1)-2.*del1*delp*delm*
02565      *        (1.+sinhmp)*(1.+sinhmm)
02566       c1 = 2.*delp*delm*(1.+sinhmp)*(1.+sinhmm)/denom
02567       c2 = -coshm2/denom
02568       c3 = coshm1/denom
02569       return
02570 c
02571 c two coefficients
02572 c
02573     2 c1 = -1./del1
02574       c2 = -c1
02575       return
02576       end
02577       subroutine curvpp (n,x,y,p,d,isw,s,eps,ys,ysp,sigma,
02578      *                   td,tsd1,hd,hsd1,hsd2,rd,rsd1,rsd2,
02579      *                   rnm1,rn,v,ierr)
02580 c
02581       integer n,isw,ierr
02582       real x(n),y(n),p,d(n),s,eps,ys(n),ysp(n),sigma,td(n),
02583      *     tsd1(n),hd(n),hsd1(n),hsd2(n),rd(n),rsd1(n),
02584      *     rsd2(n),rnm1(n),rn(n),v(n)
02585 c
02586 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
02587 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
02588 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
02589 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
02590 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
02591 c
02592 c this subroutine determines the parameters necessary to
02593 c compute a periodic smoothing spline under tension. for a
02594 c given increasing sequence of abscissae (x(i)), i = 1,...,n
02595 c and associated ordinates (y(i)), i = 1,...,n, letting p be
02596 c the period, x(n+1) = x(1)+p, and y(n+1) = y(1), the
02597 c function determined minimizes the summation from i = 1 to
02598 c n of the square of the second derivative of f plus sigma
02599 c squared times the difference of the first derivative of f
02600 c and (f(x(i+1))-f(x(i)))/(x(i+1)-x(i)) squared, over all
02601 c functions f with period p and two continuous derivatives
02602 c such that the summation of the square of
02603 c (f(x(i))-y(i))/d(i) is less than or equal to a given
02604 c constant s, where (d(i)), i = 1,...,n are a given set of
02605 c observation weights. the function determined is a periodic
02606 c spline under tension with third derivative discontinuities
02607 c at (x(i)) i = 1,...,n (and all periodic translations of
02608 c these values). for actual computation of points on the
02609 c curve it is necessary to call the function curvp2.
02610 c
02611 c on input--
02612 c
02613 c   n is the number of values to be smoothed (n.ge.2).
02614 c
02615 c   x is an array of the n increasing abscissae of the
02616 c   values to be smoothed.
02617 c
02618 c   y is an array of the n ordinates of the values to be
02619 c   smoothed, (i. e. y(k) is the functional value
02620 c   corresponding to x(k) ).
02621 c
02622 c   p is the period (p .gt. x(n)-x(1)).
02623 c
02624 c   d is a parameter containing the observation weights.
02625 c   this may either be an array of length n or a scalar
02626 c   (interpreted as a constant). the value of d
02627 c   corresponding to the observation (x(k),y(k)) should
02628 c   be an approximation to the standard deviation of error.
02629 c
02630 c   isw contains a switch indicating whether the parameter
02631 c   d is to be considered a vector or a scalar,
02632 c          = 0 if d is an array of length n,
02633 c          = 1 if d is a scalar.
02634 c
02635 c   s contains the value controlling the smoothing. this
02636 c   must be non-negative. for s equal to zero, the
02637 c   subroutine does interpolation, larger values lead to
02638 c   smoother funtions. if parameter d contains standard
02639 c   deviation estimates, a reasonable value for s is
02640 c   float(n).
02641 c
02642 c   eps contains a tolerance on the relative precision to
02643 c   which s is to be interpreted. this must be greater than
02644 c   or equal to zero and less than equal or equal to one. a
02645 c   reasonable value for eps is sqrt(2./float(n)).
02646 c
02647 c   ys is an array of length at least n.
02648 c
02649 c   ysp is an array of length at least n.
02650 c
02651 c   sigma contains the tension factor. this value indicates
02652 c   the degree to which the first derivative part of the
02653 c   smoothing functional is emphasized. if sigma is nearly
02654 c   zero (e. g. .001) the resulting curve is approximately a
02655 c   cubic spline. if sigma is large (e. g. 50.) the
02656 c   resulting curve is nearly a polygonal line. if sigma
02657 c   equals zero a cubic spline results. a standard value for
02658 c   sigma is approximately 1.
02659 c
02660 c and
02661 c
02662 c   td, tsd1, hd, hsd1, hsd2, rd, rsd1, rsd2, rnm1, rn, and
02663 c   v are arrays of length at least n which are used for
02664 c   scratch storage.
02665 c
02666 c on output--
02667 c
02668 c   ys contains the smoothed ordinate values.
02669 c
02670 c   ysp contains the values of the second derivative of the
02671 c   smoothed curve at the given nodes.
02672 c
02673 c   ierr contains an error flag,
02674 c        = 0 for normal return,
02675 c        = 1 if n is less than 2,
02676 c        = 2 if s is negative,
02677 c        = 3 if eps is negative or greater than one,
02678 c        = 4 if x-values are not strictly increasing,
02679 c        = 5 if a d-value is non-positive,
02680 c        = 6 if p is less than or equal to x(n)-x(1).
02681 c
02682 c and
02683 c
02684 c   n, x, y, d, isw, s, eps, and sigma are unaltered.
02685 c
02686 c this subroutine references package modules terms and
02687 c snhcsh.
02688 c
02689 c-----------------------------------------------------------
02690 c
02691       if (n .lt. 2) go to 25
02692       if (s .lt. 0.) go to 26
02693       if (eps .lt. 0. .or. eps .gt. 1.) go to 27
02694       if (p .le. x(n)-x(1)) go to 30
02695       ierr = 0
02696       q = 0.
02697       rsd1(1) = 0.
02698       rsd2(1) = 0.
02699       rsd2(2) = 0.
02700       rsd1(n-1) = 0.
02701       rsd2(n-1) = 0.
02702       rsd2(n) = 0.
02703 c
02704 c denormalize tension factor
02705 c
02706       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n)/p
02707 c
02708 c form t matrix and second differences of y into ys
02709 c
02710       nm1 = n-1
02711       nm2 = n-2
02712       nm3 = n-3
02713       delxi1 = x(1)+p-x(n)
02714       delyi1 = (y(1)-y(n))/delxi1
02715       call terms (dim1,tsd1(1),sigmap,delxi1)
02716       hsd1(1) = 1./delxi1
02717       do 1 i = 1,n
02718         ip1 = i+1
02719         if (i .eq. n) ip1 = 1
02720         delxi = x(ip1)-x(i)
02721         if (i .eq. n) delxi = x(1)+p-x(n)
02722         if (delxi .le. 0.) go to 28
02723         delyi = (y(ip1)-y(i))/delxi
02724         ys(i) = delyi-delyi1
02725         call terms (di,tsd1(ip1),sigmap,delxi)
02726         td(i) = di+dim1
02727         hd(i) = -(1./delxi+1./delxi1)
02728         hsd1(ip1) = 1./delxi
02729         delxi1 = delxi
02730         delyi1 = delyi
02731     1   dim1 = di
02732       hsd11 = hsd1(1)
02733       if (n .ge. 3) go to 2
02734       tsd1(2) = tsd1(1)+tsd1(2)
02735       tsd1(1) = 0.
02736       hsd1(2) = hsd1(1)+hsd1(2)
02737       hsd1(1) = 0.
02738 c
02739 c calculate lower and upper tolerances
02740 c
02741     2 sl = s*(1.-eps)
02742       su = s*(1.+eps)
02743       if (d(1) .le. 0.) go to 29
02744       if (isw .eq. 1) go to 5
02745 c
02746 c form h matrix - d array
02747 c
02748       betapp = hsd1(n)*d(n)*d(n)
02749       betap = hsd1(1)*d(1)*d(1)
02750       alphap = hd(n)*d(n)*d(n)
02751       im1 = n
02752       sumd = 0.
02753       sumy = 0.
02754       do 3 i = 1,n
02755         disq = d(i)*d(i)
02756         sumd = sumd+1./disq
02757         sumy = sumy+y(i)/disq
02758         ip1 = i+1
02759         if (i .eq. n) ip1 = 1
02760         alpha = hd(i)*disq
02761         if (d(ip1) .le. 0.) go to 29
02762         hsd1ip = hsd1(ip1)
02763         if (i .eq. n) hsd1ip = hsd11
02764         beta = hsd1ip*d(ip1)*d(ip1)
02765         hd(i) = (hsd1(i)*d(im1))**2+alpha*hd(i)
02766      *                             +beta*hsd1ip
02767         hsd2(i) = hsd1(i)*betapp
02768         hsd1(i) = hsd1(i)*(alpha+alphap)
02769         im1 = i
02770         alphap = alpha
02771         betapp = betap
02772     3   betap = beta
02773       if (n .eq. 3) hsd1(3) = hsd1(3)+hsd2(2)
02774 c
02775 c test for straight line fit
02776 c
02777       con = sumy/sumd
02778       sum = 0.
02779       do 4 i = 1,n
02780     4   sum = sum+((y(i)-con)/d(i))**2
02781       if (sum .le. su) go to 23
02782       go to 8
02783 c
02784 c form h matrix - d constant
02785 c
02786     5 sl = d(1)*d(1)*sl
02787       su = d(1)*d(1)*su
02788       hsd1p = hsd1(n)
02789       hdim1 = hd(n)
02790       sumy = 0.
02791       do 6 i = 1,n
02792         sumy = sumy+y(i)
02793         hsd1ip = hsd11
02794         if (i .lt. n) hsd1ip = hsd1(i+1)
02795         hdi = hd(i)
02796         hd(i) = hsd1(i)*hsd1(i)+hdi*hdi+hsd1ip*hsd1ip
02797         hsd2(i) = hsd1(i)*hsd1p
02798         hsd1p = hsd1(i)
02799         hsd1(i) = hsd1p*(hdi+hdim1)
02800     6   hdim1 = hdi
02801       if (n .eq. 3) hsd1(3) = hsd1(3)+hsd2(2)
02802 c
02803 c test for straight line fit
02804 c
02805       con = sumy/float(n)
02806       sum = 0.
02807       do 7 i = 1,n
02808     7   sum = sum+(y(i)-con)**2
02809       if (sum .le. su) go to 23
02810 c
02811 c top of iteration
02812 c cholesky factorization of q*t+h into r
02813 c
02814 c
02815 c i = 1
02816 c
02817     8 rd(1) = 1./(q*td(1)+hd(1))
02818       rnm1(1) = hsd2(1)
02819       yspnm1 = ys(nm1)
02820       rn(1) = q*tsd1(1)+hsd1(1)
02821       yspn = ys(n)
02822       ysp(1) = ys(1)
02823       rsd1i = q*tsd1(2)+hsd1(2)
02824       rsd1(2) = rsd1i*rd(1)
02825       sumnm1 = 0.
02826       sum2 = 0.
02827       sumn = 0.
02828       if (n .eq. 3) go to 11
02829       if (n .eq. 2) go to 12
02830 c
02831 c i = 2
02832 c
02833       rd(2) = 1./(q*td(2)+hd(2)-rsd1i*rsd1(2))
02834       rnm1(2) = -rnm1(1)*rsd1(2)
02835       rn(2) = hsd2(2)-rn(1)*rsd1(2)
02836       ysp(2) = ys(2)-rsd1(2)*ysp(1)
02837       if (n .eq. 4) go to 10
02838       do 9 i = 3,nm2
02839         rsd2i = hsd2(i)
02840         rsd1i = q*tsd1(i)+hsd1(i)-rsd2i*rsd1(i-1)
02841         rsd2(i) = rsd2i*rd(i-2)
02842         rsd1(i) = rsd1i*rd(i-1)
02843         rd(i) = 1./(q*td(i)+hd(i)-rsd1i*rsd1(i)
02844      *                           -rsd2i*rsd2(i))
02845         rnm1(i) = -rnm1(i-2)*rsd2(i)-rnm1(i-1)*rsd1(i)
02846         rnm1t = rnm1(i-2)*rd(i-2)
02847         sumnm1 = sumnm1+rnm1t*rnm1(i-2)
02848         rnm1(i-2) = rnm1t
02849         sum2 = sum2+rnm1t*rn(i-2)
02850         yspnm1 = yspnm1-rnm1t*ysp(i-2)
02851         rn(i) = -rn(i-2)*rsd2(i)-rn(i-1)*rsd1(i)
02852         rnt = rn(i-2)*rd(i-2)
02853         sumn = sumn+rnt*rn(i-2)
02854         rn(i-2) = rnt
02855         yspn = yspn-rnt*ysp(i-2)
02856     9   ysp(i) = ys(i)-rsd1(i)*ysp(i-1)-rsd2(i)*ysp(i-2)
02857 c
02858 c i = n-3
02859 c
02860    10 rnm1(nm3) = hsd2(nm1)+rnm1(nm3)
02861       rnm1(nm2) = rnm1(nm2)-hsd2(nm1)*rsd1(nm2)
02862       rnm1t = rnm1(nm3)*rd(nm3)
02863       sumnm1 = sumnm1+rnm1t*rnm1(nm3)
02864       rnm1(nm3) = rnm1t
02865       sum2 = sum2+rnm1t*rn(nm3)
02866       yspnm1 = yspnm1-rnm1t*ysp(nm3)
02867       rnt = rn(nm3)*rd(nm3)
02868       sumn = sumn+rnt*rn(nm3)
02869       rn(nm3) = rnt
02870       yspn = yspn-rnt*ysp(nm3)
02871 c
02872 c i = n-2
02873 c
02874    11 rnm1(nm2) = q*tsd1(nm1)+hsd1(nm1)+rnm1(nm2)
02875       rnm1t = rnm1(nm2)*rd(nm2)
02876       sumnm1 = sumnm1+rnm1t*rnm1(nm2)
02877       rnm1(nm2) = rnm1t
02878       rn(nm2) = hsd2(n)+rn(nm2)
02879       sum2 = sum2+rnm1t*rn(nm2)
02880       yspnm1 = yspnm1-rnm1t*ysp(nm2)
02881       rnt = rn(nm2)*rd(nm2)
02882       sumn = sumn+rnt*rn(nm2)
02883       rn(nm2) = rnt
02884       yspn = yspn-rnt*ysp(nm2)
02885 c
02886 c i = n-1
02887 c
02888    12 rd(nm1) = 1./(q*td(nm1)+hd(nm1)-sumnm1)
02889       ysp(nm1) = yspnm1
02890       rn(nm1) = q*tsd1(n)+hsd1(n)-sum2
02891       rnt = rn(nm1)*rd(nm1)
02892       sumn = sumn+rnt*rn(nm1)
02893       rn(nm1) = rnt
02894       yspn = yspn-rnt*ysp(nm1)
02895 c
02896 c i = n
02897 c
02898       rdn = q*td(n)+hd(n)-sumn
02899       rd(n) = 0.
02900       if (rdn .gt. 0.) rd(n) = 1./rdn
02901       ysp(n) = yspn
02902 c
02903 c back solve of r(transpose)* r * ysp = ys
02904 c
02905       ysp(n) = rd(n)*ysp(n)
02906       ysp(nm1) = rd(nm1)*ysp(nm1)-rn(nm1)*ysp(n)
02907       if (n .eq. 2) go to 14
02908       yspn = ysp(n)
02909       yspnm1 = ysp(nm1)
02910       do 13 ibak = 1,nm2
02911         i = nm1-ibak
02912    13   ysp(i) = rd(i)*ysp(i)-rsd1(i+1)*ysp(i+1)
02913      *                  -rsd2(i+2)*ysp(i+2)-rnm1(i)*yspnm1
02914      *                  -rn(i)*yspn
02915    14 sum = 0.
02916       delyi1 = (ysp(1)-ysp(n))/(x(1)+p-x(n))
02917       if (isw .eq. 1) go to 16
02918 c
02919 c calculation of residual norm
02920 c  - d array
02921 c
02922       do 15 i = 1,nm1
02923         delyi = (ysp(i+1)-ysp(i))/(x(i+1)-x(i))
02924         v(i) = (delyi-delyi1)*d(i)*d(i)
02925         sum = sum+v(i)*(delyi-delyi1)
02926    15   delyi1 = delyi
02927       delyi = (ysp(1)-ysp(n))/(x(1)+p-x(n))
02928       v(n) = (delyi-delyi1)*d(n)*d(n)
02929       go to 18
02930 c
02931 c calculation of residual norm
02932 c  - d constant
02933 c
02934    16 do 17 i = 1,nm1
02935         delyi = (ysp(i+1)-ysp(i))/(x(i+1)-x(i))
02936         v(i) = delyi-delyi1
02937         sum = sum+v(i)*(delyi-delyi1)
02938    17   delyi1 = delyi
02939       delyi = (ysp(1)-ysp(n))/(x(1)+p-x(n))
02940       v(n) = delyi-delyi1
02941    18   sum = sum+v(n)*(delyi-delyi1)
02942 c
02943 c test for convergence
02944 c
02945       if (sum .le. su .and. sum .ge. sl .and. q .gt. 0.)
02946      *    go to 21
02947 c
02948 c calculation of newton correction
02949 c
02950       f = 0.
02951       g = 0.
02952       rnm1sm = 0.
02953       rnsm = 0.
02954       im1 = n
02955       if (n .eq. 2) go to 20
02956       wim2 = 0.
02957       wim1 = 0.
02958       do 19 i = 1,nm2
02959         tui = tsd1(i)*ysp(im1)+td(i)*ysp(i)
02960      *                        +tsd1(i+1)*ysp(i+1)
02961         wi = tui-rsd1(i)*wim1-rsd2(i)*wim2
02962         rnm1sm = rnm1sm-rnm1(i)*wi
02963         rnsm = rnsm-rn(i)*wi
02964         f = f+tui*ysp(i)
02965         g = g+wi*wi*rd(i)
02966         im1 = i
02967         wim2 = wim1
02968    19   wim1 = wi
02969    20 tui = tsd1(nm1)*ysp(im1)+td(nm1)*ysp(nm1)
02970      *      +tsd1(n)*ysp(n)
02971       wi = tui+rnm1sm
02972       f = f+tui*ysp(nm1)
02973       g = g+wi*wi*rd(nm1)
02974       tui = tsd1(n)*ysp(nm1)+td(n)*ysp(n)
02975      *      +tsd1(1)*ysp(1)
02976       wi = tui+rnsm-rn(nm1)*wi
02977       f = f+tui*ysp(n)
02978       g = g+wi*wi*rd(n)
02979       h = f-q*g
02980       if (h .le. 0. .and. q .gt. 0.) go to 21
02981 c
02982 c update q - newton step
02983 c
02984       step = (sum-sqrt(sum*sl))/h
02985       if (sl .ne. 0.) step = step*sqrt(sum/sl)
02986       q = q+step
02987       go to 8
02988 c
02989 c store smoothed y-values and second derivatives
02990 c
02991    21 do 22 i = 1,n
02992         ys(i) = y(i)-v(i)
02993    22   ysp(i) = q*ysp(i)
02994       return
02995 c
02996 c store constant ys and zero ysp
02997 c
02998    23 do 24 i = 1,n
02999         ys(i) = con
03000    24   ysp(i) = 0.
03001       return
03002 c
03003 c n less than 2
03004 c
03005    25 ierr = 1
03006       return
03007 c
03008 c s negative
03009 c
03010    26 ierr = 2
03011       return
03012 c
03013 c eps negative or greater than 1
03014 c
03015    27 ierr = 3
03016       return
03017 c
03018 c x-values not strictly increasing
03019 c
03020    28 ierr = 4
03021       return
03022 c
03023 c weight non-positive
03024 c
03025    29 ierr = 5
03026       return
03027 c
03028 c incorrect period
03029 c
03030    30 ierr = 6
03031       return
03032       end
03033       subroutine curvss (n,x,y,d,isw,s,eps,ys,ysp,sigma,td,
03034      *                   tsd1,hd,hsd1,hsd2,rd,rsd1,rsd2,v,
03035      *                   ierr)
03036 c
03037       integer n,isw,ierr
03038       real x(n),y(n),d(n),s,eps,ys(n),ysp(n),sigma,td(n),
03039      *     tsd1(n),hd(n),hsd1(n),hsd2(n),rd(n),rsd1(n),
03040      *     rsd2(n),v(n)
03041 c
03042 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
03043 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
03044 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
03045 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
03046 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
03047 c
03048 c this subroutine determines the parameters necessary to
03049 c compute a smoothing spline under tension. for a given
03050 c increasing sequence of abscissae (x(i)), i = 1,..., n and
03051 c associated ordinates (y(i)), i = 1,..., n, the function
03052 c determined minimizes the summation from i = 1 to n-1 of
03053 c the square of the second derivative of f plus sigma
03054 c squared times the difference of the first derivative of f
03055 c and (f(x(i+1))-f(x(i)))/(x(i+1)-x(i)) squared, over all
03056 c functions f with two continuous derivatives such that the
03057 c summation of the square of (f(x(i))-y(i))/d(i) is less
03058 c than or equal to a given constant s, where (d(i)), i = 1,
03059 c ..., n are a given set of observation weights. the
03060 c function determined is a spline under tension with third
03061 c derivative discontinuities at (x(i)), i = 2,..., n-1. for
03062 c actual computation of points on the curve it is necessary
03063 c to call the function curv2.
03064 c
03065 c on input--
03066 c
03067 c   n is the number of values to be smoothed (n.ge.2).
03068 c
03069 c   x is an array of the n increasing abscissae of the
03070 c   values to be smoothed.
03071 c
03072 c   y is an array of the n ordinates of the values to be
03073 c   smoothed, (i. e. y(k) is the functional value
03074 c   corresponding to x(k) ).
03075 c
03076 c   d is a parameter containing the observation weights.
03077 c   this may either be an array of length n or a scalar
03078 c   (interpreted as a constant). the value of d
03079 c   corresponding to the observation (x(k),y(k)) should
03080 c   be an approximation to the standard deviation of error.
03081 c
03082 c   isw contains a switch indicating whether the parameter
03083 c   d is to be considered a vector or a scalar,
03084 c          = 0 if d is an array of length n,
03085 c          = 1 if d is a scalar.
03086 c
03087 c   s contains the value controlling the smoothing. this
03088 c   must be non-negative. for s equal to zero, the
03089 c   subroutine does interpolation, larger values lead to
03090 c   smoother funtions. if parameter d contains standard
03091 c   deviation estimates, a reasonable value for s is
03092 c   float(n).
03093 c
03094 c   eps contains a tolerance on the relative precision to
03095 c   which s is to be interpreted. this must be greater than
03096 c   or equal to zero and less than equal or equal to one. a
03097 c   reasonable value for eps is sqrt(2./float(n)).
03098 c
03099 c   ys is an array of length at least n.
03100 c
03101 c   ysp is an array of length at least n.
03102 c
03103 c   sigma contains the tension factor. this value indicates
03104 c   the degree to which the first derivative part of the
03105 c   smoothing functional is emphasized. if sigma is nearly
03106 c   zero (e. g. .001) the resulting curve is approximately a
03107 c   cubic spline. if sigma is large (e. g. 50.) the
03108 c   resulting curve is nearly a polygonal line. if sigma
03109 c   equals zero a cubic spline results. a standard value for
03110 c   sigma is approximately 1.
03111 c
03112 c and
03113 c
03114 c   td, tsd1, hd, hsd1, hsd2, rd, rsd1, rsd2, and v are
03115 c   arrays of length at least n which are used for scratch
03116 c   storage.
03117 c
03118 c on output--
03119 c
03120 c   ys contains the smoothed ordinate values.
03121 c
03122 c   ysp contains the values of the second derivative of the
03123 c   smoothed curve at the given nodes.
03124 c
03125 c   ierr contains an error flag,
03126 c        = 0 for normal return,
03127 c        = 1 if n is less than 2,
03128 c        = 2 if s is negative,
03129 c        = 3 if eps is negative or greater than one,
03130 c        = 4 if x-values are not strictly increasing,
03131 c        = 5 if a d-value is non-positive.
03132 c
03133 c and
03134 c
03135 c   n, x, y, d, isw, s, eps, and sigma are unaltered.
03136 c
03137 c this subroutine references package modules terms and
03138 c snhcsh.
03139 c
03140 c-----------------------------------------------------------
03141 c
03142       if (n .lt. 2) go to 16
03143       if (s .lt. 0.) go to 17
03144       if (eps .lt. 0. .or. eps .gt. 1.) go to 18
03145       ierr = 0
03146       p = 0.
03147       v(1) = 0.
03148       v(n) = 0.
03149       ysp(1) = 0.
03150       ysp(n) = 0.
03151       if (n .eq. 2) go to 14
03152       rsd1(1) = 0.
03153       rd(1) = 0.
03154       rsd2(n) = 0.
03155       rdim1 = 0.
03156       yspim2 = 0.
03157 c
03158 c denormalize tension factor
03159 c
03160       sigmap = abs(sigma)*float(n-1)/(x(n)-x(1))
03161 c
03162 c form t matrix and second differences of y into ys
03163 c
03164       nm1 = n-1
03165       nm3 = n-3
03166       delxi1 = 1.
03167       delyi1 = 0.
03168       dim1 = 0.
03169       do 1 i = 1,nm1
03170         delxi = x(i+1)-x(i)
03171         if (delxi .le. 0.) go to 19
03172         delyi = (y(i+1)-y(i))/delxi
03173         ys(i) = delyi-delyi1
03174         call terms (di,tsd1(i+1),sigmap,delxi)
03175         td(i) = di+dim1
03176         hd(i) = -(1./delxi+1./delxi1)
03177         hsd1(i+1) = 1./delxi
03178         delxi1 = delxi
03179         delyi1 = delyi
03180     1   dim1 = di
03181 c
03182 c calculate lower and upper tolerances
03183 c
03184       sl = s*(1.-eps)
03185       su = s*(1.+eps)
03186       if (isw .eq. 1) go to 3
03187 c
03188 c form h matrix - d array
03189 c
03190       if (d(1) .le. 0. .or. d(2) .le. 0.) go to 20
03191       betapp = 0.
03192       betap = 0.
03193       alphap = 0.
03194       do 2 i = 2,nm1
03195         alpha = hd(i)*d(i)*d(i)
03196         if (d(i+1) .le. 0.) go to 20
03197         beta = hsd1(i+1)*d(i+1)*d(i+1)
03198         hd(i) = (hsd1(i)*d(i-1))**2+alpha*hd(i)
03199      *                             +beta*hsd1(i+1)
03200         hsd2(i) = hsd1(i)*betapp
03201         hsd1(i) = hsd1(i)*(alpha+alphap)
03202         alphap = alpha
03203         betapp = betap
03204     2   betap = beta
03205       go to 5
03206 c
03207 c form h matrix - d constant
03208 c
03209     3 if (d(1) .le. 0.) go to 20
03210       sl = d(1)*d(1)*sl
03211       su = d(1)*d(1)*su
03212       hsd1p = 0.
03213       hdim1 = 0.
03214       do 4 i = 2,nm1
03215         hdi = hd(i)
03216         hd(i) = hsd1(i)*hsd1(i)+hdi*hdi+hsd1(i+1)*hsd1(i+1)
03217         hsd2(i) = hsd1(i)*hsd1p
03218         hsd1p = hsd1(i)
03219         hsd1(i) = hsd1p*(hdi+hdim1)
03220     4   hdim1 = hdi
03221 c
03222 c top of iteration
03223 c cholesky factorization of p*t+h into r
03224 c
03225     5 do 6 i = 2,nm1
03226         rsd2i = hsd2(i)
03227         rsd1i = p*tsd1(i)+hsd1(i)-rsd2i*rsd1(i-1)
03228         rsd2(i) = rsd2i*rdim1
03229         rdim1 = rd(i-1)
03230         rsd1(i) = rsd1i*rdim1
03231         rd(i) = 1./(p*td(i)+hd(i)-rsd1i*rsd1(i)
03232      *                           -rsd2i*rsd2(i))
03233         ysp(i) = ys(i)-rsd1(i)*ysp(i-1)-rsd2(i)*yspim2
03234     6   yspim2 = ysp(i-1)
03235 c
03236 c back solve of r(transpose)* r * ysp = ys
03237 c
03238       ysp(nm1) = rd(nm1)*ysp(nm1)
03239       if (n .eq. 3) go to 8
03240       do 7 ibak = 1,nm3
03241         i = nm1-ibak
03242     7   ysp(i) = rd(i)*ysp(i)-rsd1(i+1)*ysp(i+1)
03243      *                       -rsd2(i+2)*ysp(i+2)
03244     8 sum = 0.
03245       delyi1 = 0.
03246       if (isw .eq. 1) go to 10
03247 c
03248 c calculation of residual norm
03249 c  - d array
03250 c
03251       do 9 i = 1,nm1
03252         delyi = (ysp(i+1)-ysp(i))/(x(i+1)-x(i))
03253         v(i) = (delyi-delyi1)*d(i)*d(i)
03254         sum = sum+v(i)*(delyi-delyi1)
03255     9   delyi1 = delyi
03256       v(n) = -delyi1*d(n)*d(n)
03257       go to 12
03258 c
03259 c calculation of residual norm
03260 c  - d constant
03261 c
03262    10 do 11 i = 1,nm1
03263         delyi = (ysp(i+1)-ysp(i))/(x(i+1)-x(i))
03264         v(i) = delyi-delyi1
03265         sum = sum+v(i)*(delyi-delyi1)
03266    11   delyi1 = delyi
03267       v(n) = -delyi1
03268    12 sum = sum-v(n)*delyi1
03269 c
03270 c test for convergence
03271 c
03272       if (sum .le. su) go to 14
03273 c
03274 c calculation of newton correction
03275 c
03276       f = 0.
03277       g = 0.
03278       wim2 = 0.
03279       wim1 = 0.
03280       do 13 i = 2,nm1
03281         tui = tsd1(i)*ysp(i-1)+td(i)*ysp(i)
03282      *                        +tsd1(i+1)*ysp(i+1)
03283         wi = tui-rsd1(i)*wim1-rsd2(i)*wim2
03284         f = f+tui*ysp(i)
03285         g = g+wi*wi*rd(i)
03286         wim2 = wim1
03287    13   wim1 = wi
03288       h = f-p*g
03289       if (h .le. 0.) go to 14
03290 c
03291 c update p - newton step
03292 c
03293       step = (sum-sqrt(sum*sl))/h
03294       if (sl .ne. 0.) step = step*sqrt(sum/sl)
03295       p = p+step
03296       go to 5
03297 c
03298 c store smoothed y-values and second derivatives
03299 c
03300    14 do 15 i = 1,n
03301         ys(i) = y(i)-v(i)
03302    15   ysp(i) = p*ysp(i)
03303       return
03304 c
03305 c n less than 2
03306 c
03307    16 ierr = 1
03308       return
03309 c
03310 c s negative
03311 c
03312    17 ierr = 2
03313       return
03314 c
03315 c eps negative or greater than 1
03316 c
03317    18 ierr = 3
03318       return
03319 c
03320 c x-values not strictly increasing
03321 c
03322    19 ierr = 4
03323       return
03324 c
03325 c weight non-positive
03326 c
03327    20 ierr = 5
03328       return
03329       end
03330       function intrvl (t,x,n)
03331 c
03332       integer n
03333       real t,x(n)
03334 c
03335 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
03336 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
03337 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
03338 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
03339 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
03340 c
03341 c this function determines the index of the interval
03342 c (determined by a given increasing sequence) in which
03343 c a given value lies.
03344 c
03345 c on input--
03346 c
03347 c   t is the given value.
03348 c
03349 c   x is a vector of strictly increasing values.
03350 c
03351 c and
03352 c
03353 c   n is the length of x (n .ge. 2).
03354 c
03355 c on output--
03356 c
03357 c   intrvl returns an integer i such that
03358 c
03359 c          i =  1       if         e   t .lt. x(2)  ,
03360 c          i =  n-1     if x(n-1) .le. t            ,
03361 c          otherwise       x(i)  .le. t .le. x(i+1),
03362 c
03363 c none of the input parameters are altered.
03364 c
03365 c-----------------------------------------------------------
03366 c
03367       save i
03368       data i /1/
03369 c
03370       tt = t
03371 c
03372 c check for illegal i
03373 c
03374       if (i .ge. n) i = n/2
03375 c
03376 c check old interval and extremes
03377 c
03378       if (tt .lt. x(i)) then
03379         if (tt .le. x(2)) then
03380           i = 1
03381           intrvl = 1
03382           return
03383         else
03384           il = 2
03385           ih = i
03386         end if
03387       else if (tt .le. x(i+1)) then
03388         intrvl = i
03389         return
03390       else if (tt .ge. x(n-1)) then
03391         i = n-1
03392         intrvl = n-1
03393         return
03394       else
03395         il = i+1
03396         ih = n-1
03397       end if
03398 c
03399 c binary search loop
03400 c
03401     1 i = (il+ih)/2
03402       if (tt .lt. x(i)) then
03403          ih = i
03404       else if (tt .gt. x(i+1)) then
03405          il = i+1
03406       else
03407          intrvl = i
03408          return
03409       end if
03410       go to 1
03411       end
03412       function intrvp (t,x,n,p,tp)
03413 c
03414       integer n
03415       real t,x(n),p,tp
03416 c
03417 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
03418 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
03419 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
03420 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
03421 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
03422 c
03423 c this function determines the index of the interval
03424 c (determined by a given increasing sequence) in which a
03425 c given value lies, after translating the value to within
03426 c the correct period.  it also returns this translated value.
03427 c
03428 c on input--
03429 c
03430 c   t is the given value.
03431 c
03432 c   x is a vector of strictly increasing values.
03433 c
03434 c   n is the length of x (n .ge. 2).
03435 c
03436 c and
03437 c
03438 c   p contains the period.
03439 c
03440 c on output--
03441 c
03442 c   tp contains a translated value of t (i. e. x(1) .le. tp,
03443 c   tp .lt. x(1)+p, and tp = t + k*p for some integer k).
03444 c
03445 c   intrvl returns an integer i such that
03446 c
03447 c          i = 1       if             tp .lt. x(2)  ,
03448 c          i = n       if   x(n) .le. tp            ,
03449 c          otherwise       x(i)  .le. tp .lt. x(i+1),
03450 c
03451 c none of the input parameters are altered.
03452 c
03453 c-----------------------------------------------------------
03454 c
03455       save i
03456       data i /1/
03457 c
03458       nper = (t-x(1))/p
03459       tp = t-float(nper)*p
03460       if (tp .lt. x(1)) tp = tp+p
03461       tt = tp
03462 c
03463 c check for illegal i
03464 c
03465       if (i .ge. n) i = n/2
03466 c
03467 c check old interval and extremes
03468 c
03469       if (tt .lt. x(i)) then
03470         if (tt .le. x(2)) then
03471           i = 1
03472           intrvp = 1
03473           return
03474         else
03475           il = 2
03476           ih = i
03477         end if
03478       else if (tt .le. x(i+1)) then
03479         intrvp = i
03480         return
03481       else if (tt .ge. x(n)) then
03482         i = n
03483         intrvp = n
03484         return
03485       else
03486         il = i+1
03487         ih = n
03488       end if
03489 c
03490 c binary search loop
03491 c
03492     1 i = (il+ih)/2
03493       if (tt .lt. x(i)) then
03494          ih = i
03495       else if (tt .gt. x(i+1)) then
03496          il = i+1
03497       else
03498          intrvp = i
03499          return
03500       end if
03501       go to 1
03502       end
03503       subroutine snhcsh (sinhm,coshm,x,isw)
03504 c
03505       integer isw
03506       real sinhm,coshm,x
03507 c
03508 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
03509 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
03510 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
03511 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
03512 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
03513 c
03514 c this subroutine returns approximations to
03515 c       sinhm(x) = sinh(x)/x-1
03516 c       coshm(x) = cosh(x)-1
03517 c and
03518 c       coshmm(x) = (cosh(x)-1-x*x/2)/(x*x)
03519 c with relative error less than 1.0e-6
03520 c
03521 c on input--
03522 c
03523 c   x contains the value of the independent variable.
03524 c
03525 c   isw indicates the function desired
03526 c           = -1 if only sinhm is desired,
03527 c           =  0 if both sinhm and coshm are desired,
03528 c           =  1 if only coshm is desired,
03529 c           =  2 if only coshmm is desired,
03530 c           =  3 if both sinhm and coshmm are desired.
03531 c
03532 c on output--
03533 c
03534 c   sinhm contains the value of sinhm(x) if isw .le. 0 or
03535 c   isw .eq. 3 (sinhm is unaltered if isw .eq.1 or isw .eq.
03536 c   2).
03537 c
03538 c   coshm contains the value of coshm(x) if isw .eq. 0 or
03539 c   isw .eq. 1 and contains the value of coshmm(x) if isw
03540 c   .ge. 2 (coshm is unaltered if isw .eq. -1).
03541 c
03542 c and
03543 c
03544 c   x and isw are unaltered.
03545 c
03546 c-----------------------------------------------------------
03547 c
03548       data sp13/.3029390e-5/,
03549      *     sp12/.1975135e-3/,
03550      *     sp11/.8334261e-2/,
03551      *     sp10/.1666665e0/
03552       data sp24/.3693467e-7/,
03553      *     sp23/.2459974e-5/,
03554      *     sp22/.2018107e-3/,
03555      *     sp21/.8315072e-2/,
03556      *     sp20/.1667035e0/
03557       data sp33/.6666558e-5/,
03558      *     sp32/.6646307e-3/,
03559      *     sp31/.4001477e-1/,
03560      *     sq32/.2037930e-3/,
03561      *     sq31/-.6372739e-1/,
03562      *     sq30/.6017497e1/
03563       data sp43/.2311816e-4/,
03564      *     sp42/.2729702e-3/,
03565      *     sp41/.9868757e-1/,
03566      *     sq42/.1776637e-3/,
03567      *     sq41/-.7549779e-1/,
03568      *     sq40/.9110034e1/
03569       data cp4/.2982628e-6/,
03570      *     cp3/.2472673e-4/,
03571      *     cp2/.1388967e-2/,
03572      *     cp1/.4166665e-1/,
03573      *     cp0/.5000000e0/
03574 c
03575       ax = abs(x)
03576       if (isw .ge. 0) go to 5
03577 c
03578 c sinhm approximation
03579 c
03580       if (ax .gt. 4.45) go to 2
03581       xs = ax*ax
03582       if (ax .gt. 2.3) go to 1
03583 c
03584 c sinhm approximation on (0.,2.3)
03585 c
03586       sinhm = xs*(((sp13*xs+sp12)*xs+sp11)*xs+sp10)
03587       return
03588 c
03589 c sinhm approximation on (2.3,4.45)
03590 c
03591     1 sinhm = xs*((((sp24*xs+sp23)*xs+sp22)*xs+sp21)
03592      .               *xs+sp20)
03593       return
03594     2 if (ax .gt. 7.65) go to 3
03595 c
03596 c sinhm approximation on (4.45,7.65)
03597 c
03598       xs = ax*ax
03599       sinhm = xs*(((sp33*xs+sp32)*xs+sp31)*xs+1.)/
03600      .             ((sq32*xs+sq31)*xs+sq30)
03601       return
03602     3 if (ax .gt. 10.1) go to 4
03603 c
03604 c sinhm approximation on (7.65,10.1)
03605 c
03606       xs = ax*ax
03607       sinhm = xs*(((sp43*xs+sp42)*xs+sp41)*xs+1.)/
03608      .             ((sq42*xs+sq41)*xs+sq40)
03609       return
03610 c
03611 c sinhm approximation above 10.1
03612 c
03613     4 sinhm = exp(ax)/(ax+ax)-1.
03614       return
03615 c
03616 c coshm and (possibly) sinhm approximation
03617 c
03618     5 if (isw .ge. 2) go to 7
03619       if (ax .gt. 2.3) go to 6
03620       xs = ax*ax
03621       coshm = xs*((((cp4*xs+cp3)*xs+cp2)*xs+cp1)*xs+cp0)
03622       if (isw .eq. 0) sinhm = xs*(((sp13*xs+sp12)*xs+sp11)
03623      .                              *xs+sp10)
03624       return
03625     6 expx = exp(ax)
03626       coshm = (expx+1./expx)/2.-1.
03627       if (isw .eq. 0) sinhm = (expx-1./expx)/(ax+ax)-1.
03628       return
03629 c
03630 c coshmm and (possibly) sinhm approximation
03631 c
03632     7 xs = ax*ax
03633       if (ax .gt. 2.3) go to 8
03634       coshm = xs*(((cp4*xs+cp3)*xs+cp2)*xs+cp1)
03635       if (isw .eq. 3) sinhm = xs*(((sp13*xs+sp12)*xs+sp11)
03636      .                              *xs+sp10)
03637       return
03638     8 expx = exp(ax)
03639       coshm = ((expx+1./expx-xs)/2.-1.)/xs
03640       if (isw .eq. 3) sinhm = (expx-1./expx)/(ax+ax)-1.
03641       return
03642       end
03643       subroutine terms (diag,sdiag,sigma,del)
03644 c
03645       real diag,sdiag,sigma,del
03646 c
03647 c                                 coded by alan kaylor cline
03648 c                           from fitpack -- january 26, 1987
03649 c                        a curve and surface fitting package
03650 c                      a product of pleasant valley software
03651 c                  8603 altus cove, austin, texas 78759, usa
03652 c
03653 c this subroutine computes the diagonal and superdiagonal
03654 c terms of the tridiagonal linear system associated with
03655 c spline under tension interpolation.
03656 c
03657 c on input--
03658 c
03659 c   sigma contains the tension factor.
03660 c
03661 c and
03662 c
03663 c   del contains the step size.
03664 c
03665 c on output--
03666 c
03667 c                sigma*del*cosh(sigma*del) - sinh(sigma*del)
03668 c   diag = del*--------------------------------------------.
03669 c                     (sigma*del)**2 * sinh(sigma*del)
03670 c
03671 c                   sinh(sigma*del) - sigma*del
03672 c   sdiag = del*----------------------------------.
03673 c                (sigma*del)**2 * sinh(sigma*del)
03674 c
03675 c and
03676 c
03677 c   sigma and del are unaltered.
03678 c
03679 c this subroutine references package module snhcsh.
03680 c
03681 c-----------------------------------------------------------
03682 c
03683       if (sigma .ne. 0.) go to 1
03684       diag = del/3.
03685       sdiag = del/6.
03686       return
03687     1 sigdel = sigma*del
03688       call snhcsh (sinhm,coshm,sigdel,0)
03689       denom = sigma*sigdel*(1.+sinhm)
03690       diag = (coshm-sinhm)/denom
03691       sdiag = sinhm/denom
03692       return
03693       end
